f.d: [gzi brjid las khol du phyung ba theg pa rim pa dgu]
THE NINE WAYS OF BON (Excerpts from gZi-brjid)
I. PHYA GSHEN THEG PA
I. THE WAY OF THE SHEN OF PREDICTION
[extract from vol. kha, f. 184a5 onwards]
mo rtsis gto dpyad bzhi po la // spyi ru bshad dang sgos kyi bshad //
For the four subjects of (i) sortilege, (ii) astrological calculation, (iii) ritual; and (iv) diagnosis, there are explanations in general and in particular—
spyi ru rnam grangs bstan pa dang // sgos su 'dus so 'dzin pa gnyis //
an explanation of general lists and a concentration on particulars. These are the two matters of consideration.

thog mar spyi'i rnam grangs la // pra ltas mo yi mtshan nyid la // mo pra sum brgya drug cu mchis // rno mthong rtsis kyi mtshan nyid la // gab rtse sum brgya drug cu mchis // na gso gto yi mtshan nyid la // gto thabs sum brgya drug cu mchis // 'chi bslu dpyad kyi mtshan nyid la // dpyad thabs nyi khri gcig stong mchis // spyi ru bstan pa'i rnam grangs nges //

First we deal with general lists: In characterizing sortilege, which is the divining of prognostics, there are 360 sortilege prognostics. In characterizing astrological calculation, which perceives so sharply, there are 360 horoscopes. In characterizing rites of curing illness, there are 360 methods. In characterizing diagnosis, which provides ransoms for death, there are 21,000 methods of diagnosis. Such indeed are the lists explained in general.
sgos su bsdus pa'i 'dus so la //
As for concentrating on particulars,

mo la rnam pa bzhi yin te // ye srid 'phrul gyi ju thig dang // ye mkhyen sgra bla'i mngon shes dang // ye rje [184b] smon pa'i rmi lam dang // ye dbang lha yi bka' bab dang // rnam pa bzhi ru shes par bya //

there are four kinds of sortilege: (a) the knot-sortilege of Ye-srid-'phrul, (b) the clairvoyance of Ye-mkhyen sgra-bla, (c) the dream of Ye-rje smon-pa (d) the soothsaying of Ye-dbang-lha. So they are to be known as of four kinds.

rtsis la rnam pa bzhi yin te // gab rtse 'phrul gyi me long dang // spar kha sme ba gling skor dang // 'byung ba dus kyi 'khor lo dang // ju zhag rten 'brel las rtsis dang // rnam pa bzhi ru shes par bya //

There are four kinds of astrological calculation: (a) the mirror of mysterious horoscopes, (b) the sPar-kha and sMe-ba circle, (c) the Time Wheel of the Elements, (d) calculations of combinations and effects by (the method known as) ju-zhag. Thus they are known as of four kinds.

gto la rnam pa bzhi yin te // 'byung ba 'khrugs pa'i yo gto dang // mdos cha rten 'brel brdeg gto dang // bag nyan zlog pa'i thun gto dang // mnyam gnyis bsor ba'i brje gto dang // rnam pa bzhi ru shes par bya //

There are four kinds of ritual: (а) the ‘Awry’ Rite for the elements in disorder, (b) the ‘Striking’ Rite using a combination of devices, (c) the ‘Harrying’ Rite for overcoming evil influences, (d) the ‘Exchange’ Rite of transposing two equal things. Thus they are known as four kinds.

dpyad la rnam pa bzhi yin te // rgyu rkyen mthong la dpyad pa dang // ngos 'dzin rtsa la dpyad pa dang // phan gnod chu la dpyad pa dang // 'chi sos khams la dpyad pa dang // rnam pa bzhi ru shes par bya //

There are four kinds of diagnosis: (a) Diagnosis by seeing the chief and subsidiary causes, (b) Identification by examination of the connecting channels, (c) Diagnosis of the urine (to discover) what will be of use and what is causing harm, (d) Diagnosis of (the patient’s) appearance (to discover) whether he will die or be cured. Thus they are known as four kinds.
mo rtsis gto dpyad bzhi bo las // kun gyi thog mar mo yi snga //
Of these four, sortilege, calculation, ritual, and diagnosis, sortilege comes first as the foremost.
i
i
ye srid 'phrul gyi rgyal po dang // kun shes 'phrul gyi drang mkhan gnyis // mngon shes phya'u g.yang dkar gsum // srid pa'i pra ltas gtan la phabs // bden brdzun las kyi drang shan phyes //

The three (gods) Ye-srid-'phrul-gyi rgyal-po, Kun-shes-'phrul-gyi drang-mkhan, and mNgon-shes phya'u g.yang-dkar arranged this divination of prognostics for the phenomenal world, making a straight-forward distinction of true and false effects.

mthong dang mi mthong brtag tshad dbab // de la dpyad cing chag la gzhal // chag la gzhal cing rtsis la gdab // snga phyi da lta'i yin tshul dang // skyon yon tshe tshad gtan la dbab // bzang ngan phan gnod grangs su gzung // grangs su bzung zhing rtsis la gdab // mo dang rtsis la bla bzung nas // bar du gso rkyen gto yis byed // med la yod dang stong la gang // 'grib la 'phel dang 'jig la chag // dbul la phyug dang 'chi ba sos // gnod la phan dang mkho la rtsis // skye 'gro de yis [185a] gso bar byed // tha mar las mtha' dpyad kyis sdud // mi bde tha mar bde bar sdud // na ba tha mar sos par sdud // gnod pa'i tha mar phan par sdud // 'chi ba'i tha mar bslang bar sdud // dug gi tha mar rtsi ru sdud // las kyis chad na 'brel bar sdud // kun rdzob thabs la brten pa tsam // phya gshen thugs kyi dkyil du zhog // ces gsungs so /

Make an examination from what is seen and what is not seen. On the basis of this diagnosis, make an estimate. Having made an estimate, fix your calculations, take stock of (the patient’s) former, future, and present state, his disadvantages and his advantages. Count up the good and bad points, the beneficial and the harmful ones. Having counted them up, fix your calculations. Relying on your sortilege and calculation, you next act by means of the rite the conditions (necessary) for the cure. Being for non-being, filling where there was emptiness, increase for decrease, production for destruction, wealth for poverty, recovery instead of death, benefit instead of harm, by thus accounting (to him) whatever is required, by these means you cure the person concerned. Finally as the end of the effects he is integrated by means of the diagnosis. As the end of unhappiness he is integrated in happiness. As the end of sickness he is integrated in recovery. As the end of harm he is integrated with what benefits. As the end of death he is integrated in being raised up. As the end of poison he is integrated with elixir. If anything is broken by his karmic effects, it is now integrated by being brought into union. (All this) is just reliance on methods which refer to relative truth. Phya-gshen, keep it in your mind!
yang ston pas bka' stsal pa / nyon cig legs rgyal thang po nyon // de rnams grangs kyi rim pa'o //
Again the Teacher (Shen-rab) said: Listen, Legs-rgyal Thang-po, listen! Those items have been ordered in lists.

da gnyis pa 'jug dang spyod pa ni // thog mar 'jug pa'i rim pa la // sems skyed snying rje'i gzhi bzung nas // 'gro la phan pa'i sems ldan zhing // mo rtsis gto dpyad gang bslab kyang // mkhas par bya la shes par bslab //

Now secondly as for setting to work and practising, at the start of the process of setting to work raise your Thought towards Enlightenment and keep compassion as your basis, and with your mind intent on benefiting living beings, whatever you learn of sortilege, calculation, rites, and diagnosis, be clever and learn so as to know it!

mkhas pas gnod la gnyen par bya // brnyas par byung na gyong por sdod // 'dun par byung na ran tshod 'dzin // gus par byung na legs par bslab // rgol ba byung na phyi shul gcod // rtsod pa byung na ngang thag bsring // 'gran par byung na ngang gis gzhag // phan par byung yang nga bo spang // gnod par byung yang zhom par gzhil // 'thad par byung yang rang sor gzhag // mi 'thad byung yang thabs kyis spang // khro gtum can la bzhin mi bzlog // g.yo sgyu can la 'dzum mi ston // bslu brid can la mtshar mi bzhad // log khrid can la kha mi ya // drang por smra la ngag mi bskung // g.yo can tshig la mchid ma byin // rdzun chen gtam gyi rjes mi 'breng // mtho sar phyin kyang dma' mo bskyang // chen po red kyang dma' mo bskyang // mkhas par byung yang mi shes khrid // goms par yod kyang tshod la brtag // [185b] 'bul tshogs che yang shed mi bskyed // chung yang sems bskyed rim par bya // gang du mi bzod de dang bstun // rang dang tshod kha thabs dang sbyor // mod par mi bya dkon par 'tshangs // dkon par mi bya bden par bkrol //

A clever man should turn harmful things to good use. If others would contemn you, stay stern. If people agree with you, take a right measure in their regard. If some show devotion, instruct them well. If some oppose you, cut off future trace of them. If there are arguments, be long-suffering. If others would vie with you, be indifferent to them. Although you benefit others, avoid pride. Although you cause harm, get rid of despondency. If things turn out well, accept them as they are. If things turn out ill, find a method to avoid them. Do not turn your face away from an angry man. Do not show a smiling countenance to one who comes with deceiving words. Do not laugh in wonderment at a man who deceives. Do not reply to one who tempts you. Do not conceal your words from a man who speaks honestly. Do not give reply to deceiving words. Do not follow after false rumours. Although you reach a high position, protect lowly people. Although you are great, protect lowly people. Although you are clever, guide those who do not know. Although you are experienced, watch your own measure. Although large offerings are made to you, do not act the big man. Although they are small, raise your Thought towards Enlightenment in the proper way. Where no one is patient continue to act kindly. Apply yourself suitably in due measure and with skill. Do not do too much. Treat (your learning) as precious. But do not do too little. Explain things truly.

spyir ni rgyu 'bras bon rnams la // sems bskyed gzhi ma med pa na // gang yang rgyu yi 'bras mi 'tshol // don dam rnyed pa ga la 'gyur // rgyu yi bon la gtogs lags kyang // byang chub sems kyis ngang thag bsring // de nas 'gro la phan thog 'byung // lag len med pa'i tshod mda' spang // shes so bsam pa'i che ba spang // mkhas so bsam pa'i dregs pa spang //

If as a general rule both in the Bon of Cause and the Bon of Effect, you do not raise your Thought towards Enlightenment as your basic intent, you will not gain anywhere the (higher) effects of the (worldly) causes. So how should one obtain the highest truth? Although one is concerned here with the Bon of Cause, keep going all the time with the Thought of Enlightenment. Thence benefit will come to living beings. Avoid unskilful precipitancy. Avoid the self-esteem of thinking one knows. Avoid the pride of thinking one is clever.

gzhan la 'dzug pa'i tsher ma spang // rang la bstod pa'i 'phyar g.yeng spang // mi shes pa yi pho rgo spang // mi mthun pa yi bya ba spang // mi 'gro ba yi yas stags spang // ma mthong ba yi rdzun bu spang // ma rig pa yi dom chol spang // mi shes pa yi kha bo spang // ma phyin pa yi lo rgyus spang // ma myong ba yi lag len spang // mi 'dra ba yi las spyod spang // mi ldan pa yi 'dod bzhed spang // spyir yang g.yo dang sgyu med cing // blun po'i gseb du mkhas pa rmongs // mi shes pa la phal dang 'dra // ma rig pa (la) gser yang rdo //

Avoid pricking thorns into others. Avoid the relaxation of being pleased with yourself. Avoid the insolence of one who does not know. Avoid acts which do not fit the occasion. Avoid ritual items which are unsuitable. Avoid untruths of things unseen. Avoid ignorant gossip. Avoid ignorant ‘big talk’. Avoid news of where you have not been. Avoid techniques in which you are inexperienced. Avoid unsuitable activities. Avoid desiring what you do not possess. In all things be free from deceit. In the company of fools a clever man (appears) foolish. To those who do not know he seems quite ordinary. To the ignorant gold may seem as stone.

de phyir mkhas pa mkhas gral btsun // mo rtsis gto dpyad gang spyod kyang // 'jug dang bslab rim spang dang blang // dgos pa'i rim pa de ltar bya // de nas mkhas shing goms pa dang // 'dris shing rgyud la brten pa des // thabs mkhas lag len ldan pa de // mkhas par yongs su bkur gnas 'byung // gang zhig de las de spros pa'i // [186a] phya gshen theg pa'i 'gro ba 'dren // snang srid dga' bde bskyed pa yis // dpag med rgya cher 'phel bar 'gyur // ces gsungs so /

Therefore it is good for a clever man to be among clever men. Sortilege, calculation, ritual, diagnosis, whichever of these you do, you must follow the required order, avoiding or accepting (as occasion demands) in starting (this work) and in the order of instruction. Thus by being skilled and accomplished, experienced and self-reliant, clever in method and skilful, such a man will be honoured for his skill. As for what spreads forth from this, he acts thereby as guide in the Way of the Shen of Prediction, producing happiness in the phenomenal world and causing it to spread wide and boundless.

yang gsungs pa / nyon cig legs rgyal thang po nyon // thog mar 'jug tshul de ltar la // bar du spyod pa'i rim pa ni // mo rtsis gto dpyad bzhi po la // dang po mo pra brtag pa yang // gzhi ma ling phying dkar po la // sngon mo nas kyi sbran ma blug // mtsho ro g.yu yi sgron ma btag // li mar mda' yi srog mkhar btsug // bdud rtsi'i shing gi dud par sbreng // dri zhim spos kyi gshegs shul mtshon // phye mar 'ol kon phud kyis mchod //

Again he said: Listen, Legs-rgyal Than-po, listen! The way of setting about this work is as above. Now next we deal with the order of operation. Of sortilege, calculation, ritual and diagnosis, first we consider the prognostics of sortilege. On a piece of white felt which serves as the basis one places the ‘sprinklings’ of green barley, and one sets up the ‘symbol of life’, the bronze-tipped arrow, to which is attached a turquoise ornament. There are wafts of smoke from the incense-wood, marking the way taken by the sweet-smelling incense. Worship with an offering of the sacrificial heap of barley-flour and butter.

g.yu 'brang bdud rtsi skyems kyis gsol // sgrub gshen dbal bon smrang gis bkrol // lha chen phu wer dkar po mchod // ye srid 'phrul gyi ju thig bdar // ye mkhyen sgra bla'i mngon shes bsgrub // ye rje smon pa'i rmi lam brtag // ye bdang lha yi bka' dbab bya // snga stangs thams cad ming nas bzung // phyi stangs thams cad thig la btab // skyon yon tshe tshad yi ger bris // bzang ngan legs nyes drang shan phyes // bden rdzun srid pa'i gzu bor bya // gang la gang dgos ci bzhin du // phan gdab rim pa de ltar bya //

Worship with the sacrificial offering of consecrated chang. The officiating priest should recite the exposition. Worship the great god Phu-wer dkar-po. Invoke the knot-sortilege of Ye-srid-'phrul. Produce (within yourself) the clairvoyance of Ye-mkhyen sgra-bla. Reflect upon the dream of Ye-rje smon-pa. Effect the soothsaying of Ye-dbang-lha. Name everything that has happened in the past (of your client). Set in order everything referring to the future. Write down evils and benefits (to come) and the length of his life. Distinguish in a straightforward way the good and the bad, the fair and the foul. Truth and falsehood there may be, but make true distinction. Such is the way of benefiting people, according as each may require.
ii
ii

gnyis pa gab rtse brtsi ba la // za 'og ber gyi gdan steng du // rtsis kyi sho gzhi khra bo bkod // rtsis kyi so rdo dkar nag bkram // ye srid lha dbang rgyal po mchod // 'byung ba dus kyi lha mo brngan // dbang chen bdag por mnga' yang gsol // de nas chag la gzhal te brtsi // gab rtse 'phrul gyi me long blta // spar kha sme ba gling skor bya // 'byung ba dus kyi 'khor lo brtsi // [186b] ju zhag srid pa'i rten 'brel brtag // brtag cing rig pas dpyad cing dbye // snga phyi da lta'i yin tshul dang // rgyu dang rkyen las srid tshul dang // las dang smon lam mthun tshul dang // bskal srid 'byung ba'i 'gyur tshul dang // rten 'brel sngon la dbang tshul dang // nam zla dus bzhi'i 'gyur tshul dang // lha bdud klung rta'i dar rgud dang // skyon yon las kyi 'phen len dang // dge sdig tshe tshad chag tshad dang // lo zla zhag grangs dus tshod dang // 'phel dang 'grib pa'i mtshan nyid rnams // mkhas par byas la dal bar rtsi //

Secondly for calculating the horoscopes, on a cloth (made) of a piece of brocade silk one must set the squared calculating board, arrange the white and black pieces. Worship Ye-srid lha-dbang rgyal-po. Requite the goddesses of the Elements and Time-Periods. Pray to dBan-chen bdag-po. Then make an estimate and calculate. Look in the mystic mirror of the horoscope. Work the sPar-kha sMe-ba Circle. Calculate the cycles of the Elements and the Time Periods. Examine the combinations occurring by (the method)ju-zhag. Examining them, identify and distinguish them knowledgeably: the former, past and present state, the way it comes about from major and minor causes, the way events and prayers have corresponded, ways of change in Time, Existence and the Elements, the way these influence former combinations, ways of change in the Four Seasons, Strength and weakness of gods, demons and klung-rta, avoiding and accepting the effects of evils and benefits, an estimate of good and bad and of length of life, the characteristics of increase and decrease of the years, the months, the days, the hours, a wise man must do this and calculate it quietly.
gang du gnod pa ngos kyis bzung // gang la 'phan pa brda yis sprad // gang dang mthun pa'i rten 'brel bsgrig // gang du 'byung ba yi ger btab // sems can 'gro la phan gdag bya //

He must identify harm wherever it is, and explain benefits wherever they are, and arrange whatever combinations can be brought into accord. He must write down whatever will happen, and so bring benefit to living beings.
iii
iii

gsum pa gto yis gso ba la // 'gro ba ma rig sems can rnams // spar kha lo skor sme ba gling // 'byung ba dgra gshed 'khrugs pa dang // stong gsum 'khrugs pa'i yo gto bya // gtsang ma'i sa las ma 'dal dang // sa tshon sna lngas dal du bris // rtsi shing bal tshon dar sna lnga // 'bru sna'i bshos gtsang dkar mngar phud // 'byung ba dus kyi lha mo mchod // rgyal ba'i bden pa smrang gis bkrol // 'byung ba snying phur 'khrugs pa bsal // 'khrugs pa gnas su mnyam par bzhag //

Thirdly as for making cures by means of rites for living beings, ignorant creatures, when sPar-kha, Year-Cycle, the sMe-ba sphere, and antagonistic elements are in disarray, one must perform the ‘Awry’ Rite for the Universe in disarray. Draw a magic circle with clean sand, a circle drawn with sand of five colours. (Set up) twigs with coloured wools and silk of five colours. Make a first offering of a pure sacrificial cake made from different grains, and of the three milk and the three sweet substances. Worship the goddesses of the Elements and the Time-Periods. Recite as a prayer some true expositions of the Conqueror. Thus the completely disarrayed elements will be quietened, And everything disarrayed will be put in place.

sems can mi rnams dbul 'phongs pa // tshe dpal bsod nams bskyed pa'i phyir // mdos cha rten 'brel brdeg gto bya // gzhi ma gtsang ma'i steng du ni // 'bru yis g.yung drung 'khyil ba bris // mdos cha phya rten g.yang rten bshams // gser skyems brngan cha g.yu 'brang phud // phya g.yang dpal gyi lha brgyad mchod // [187a] bon rnams thams cad rten cing 'brel // rten cing 'brel ba'i ya ka brjod // 'gro la phan bdes gso bar bya //

In order to produce long life, happiness and good fortune for those creatures wretched men, Perform the ‘Striking’ Rite, combining use of ritual devices. On some clean place as working-base draw a swastika in grain. Prepare the devices for the rite, the implements and talismans. Offer libations, gifts and consecrated chang. Worship the eight gods of Prediction and Good Fortune And bring all phenomenal elements into interrelation. Pronounce the blessing of interrelationship, and beings will be cured with benefits and happiness.
'gro drug sems can thams cad ni // kag la bab cing 'chi bar nyen // kag las thar dang nyes bzlog phyir // pra mtshan rig pas bsnun pa'i gto //

When beings of the Six Spheres Are struck with an impediment and come near to death, in order to save them from impediments and reverse this evil, (use) the ‘Stinging’ Rite which works by knowledge of prognostic signs.

bdud btsan ma mo gshin rje dang // tshe bdud kag sri srog bdud la // tshe bslu srog gta' srog mkhar gzugs // tshe skyin srog glud lan chags 'jal // tshe dpal skyob pa'i lha brgyad mchod // bab nyen bzlog cing kag las thar //

For devils, fiends, she-demons, spirits of death, devils which attack man’s length of days, sprites which cause impediments, and devils which attack the life-force, (against these) establish life-ransoms, life-pledges and amulets. Pay debts of evil with life-ransoms as payment for life. Worship the eight gods who preserve life and happiness. Reverse the troubles that befall men and save them from their impediments.

'chi ba bslus shing srog mkhar 'tshugs // 'gro la phan bde dga' ba bskyed // 'gro ba sems can thams cad la // lha srin za kha sdang ba dang // sde brgyad byol kha bab pa dang // mnyam gnyis bsor ba'i brje gto bya // mdos dang yas stags rdzas rnams bsag // sku glud ring tshad ngar mi dang // nam rgyang mda' 'phang shing ris dang // pho thong mo thong mtshe nyung dang // mi nor yul mkhar 'dod yon dang // mnyam gnyis brjes na glud re bzang // mtshungs gnyis bsor na skyin re 'dam // rgyal ba 'phags pa'i tshogs rnams la // phyag 'tshal mchod 'bul skyabs 'gro bya // glud yas bden pas bkrol te 'bul // tshe zad dus la bab gyur yang // lo gsum bar du bzhol bar 'gyur // 'gro la phan phyir gto yis gso // 'bul ba yon gyis mnyes par bya // gto yi phan thabs bstan pa'o //

Thus he is ransomed from death and fixed up with an amulet, and so you produce benefits, joy and happiness for living beings. For all living beings, afflicted with attacks by the eight kinds of sprite, by hating and consuming gods and demons, you must perform the ‘Exchange’ Rite of transposing two equal things. Prepare the ritual devices and ritual items, the right sized figurine as ransom for the (patient’s) body, the sky symbol, the tree symbol, the arrow, distaff, and the ritual stakes, the male figure, the female figure, the rock-plant mtshe, and mustard-seed, (a model of) the house and its wealth, the things one desires. If they are exchanged as equal things, the ransom will be good. If they are transposed as equivalents, they will be chosen as payment. To the hosts of noble buddhas make salutation, offerings and prayer for refuge. Then offer the items of ransom, explaining them truly. Although (your patient) is about to die, you can delay his death for the space of three years. In order to benefit beings, profit them by means of these rites. They will make you happy with offerings and fees. So the benefits of ritual have now been explained.
iv
iv

bzhi pa dpyad kyis 'tsho ba la // 'gro drug sems can ma rig pa // nyon mongs nad kyis gdung ba la // nad la dpyad kyis phan pa'i phyir // sman pa byang chub sems [187b] ldan gyis // tshad med bzhi yi sems bskyed nas // rgyal ba'i tshogs la skyabs su 'gro // drin len mchod pa ma 'dal 'bul // sangs rgyas sman lha mched brgyad dang // be du rgya 'od rgyal po mchod // mkhas khyad lag len ldan pa yis // rgyu rkyen thams cad mthong la dpyad // nad ngos 'dzin pa rtsa la dpyad // phan gnod thams cad chu la dpyad // 'chi sos thams cad khams la dpyad // de ltar nad ngos 'dzin pa dang // tsha grangs bad mkhris 'dus pa las // bsil drod snyoms pa'i sman sbyar nas // phye ma ri lu 'de gu dang // thang dang byug dang sman mar dang // gang la gang sman ['gro ba] nad dang sbyar //

Fourthly in caring (for others) by means of diagnosis, when the ignorant beings of the Six Spheres suffer from diseases (arising from) molestations (kleśa), in order to benefit them in their illness by diagnosis, the physician with his Thought set on Enlightenment, should raise his thought to the four immeasurable virtues, take refuge in the hosts of buddhas, and offer a maṇḍala in thanksgiving and worship. He should worship the King Be-du-rgya-'od (Vaiḍūrya) and his eight fellow buddhas, gods of medicine. Then he should diagnose the major and minor causes in all that can be seen, and identify the disease by diagnosis of the connecting channels. Diagnose from the urine what is of benefit and what is of harm. Diagnose from the appearance all signs of death and signs of cure. Thus identifying the disease, Heat or cold, phlegm or bile, or some combination, the medicine is then applied, cooling, warming, equalizing, powder, pills, or syrup, potion, ointment, or butter-mould. Medicine for every man must fit with the disease.

tsha ba thams cad bsil gyis 'dul // grang ba thams cad drod kyis 'dul // bad kan thams cad gsing gis dbye // mkhris pa can rnams bsdud kyis byin // 'du ba 'khrugs na snyoms kyis 'dul // 'du ba nyi khri chig stong la // nyi khri chig stong sman sbyor gyis // ma rig nyon mongs drungs nas 'byin //

All feverish conditions are counteracted by the cooling kind, all cold conditions by the warming kind, all phlegmatic conditions by the dispersing kind, conditions of bile by the uniting kind, combination disturbances by the equalizing kind. For the 21,000 types of combinations one applies 21,000 types of medicine, and so expels the afflicted conditions of ignorance.
'tsho ba rnam pa bzhi yin te // bdud rtsi sman gyis 'tsho ba dang // lus gso sman gyis 'tsho ba dang // thabs dang spyod lam 'tsho ba dang // lung ma bstan gyis 'tsho ba 'o //
Treatment is of four main kinds: treatment with medicine of elixir, treatment with medicine for bodily cure, treatment with method and practice, treatment in unprescribed ways.

bcos la rnam pa bzhi yin te // sman dang gtar dang me btsa' dang // thabs dang sngags kyis zhi byed pa // gang dgos nad kyi ngo dang sbyar // [sman pa] ro dang nus pa zhu ba'i rjes // ro yi drod dang nus pas drag // zhu rjes 'jam la des pa'o //

Curing is of four main kinds: medicine, bleeding and branding, tranquillizing with method and spells. Whatever is required must accord with the type of disease. After absorbing (the medicine) come taste and effect, pleasance of taste and force of effect. After absorption it is gentle and pleasant.
nad la skyug dang bshal dang rjes // skyug gis 'dren dang bshal bas sbyangs // rjes shul zhi dang bde ba'o //
For the disease vomiting and excretion are the after-effects, drawing it forth by vomiting and purifying by excretion, and the after-state is tranquil and pleasant.

kha zas 'byor dang gnod dang snyoms // 'byor ba brten la gnod pa spang // snyoms kyi cha mnyam ran tshod bzung // dpyad la rtsa dang chu dang khams // rtsa la lta zhing chu la [188a] brtags // khams la dpyad cing thig par bya // nges par 'chi ba'i ltas mthong na // dkar po dge ba'i las la 'bad // las kyis chad na gto dpyad rdug // nan tar 'chi ba'i dus byung na // lus gso zas kyang srog gi bdud // de ltar ma lags 'phral rkyen dang // glo bur nad kyis gdung ba la // 'tsho ba sman gyis slus par 'gyur //

Food may be suitable, harmful, or indifferent. Keep to what is suitable and avoid what is harmful, taking the right measure of the part that is indifferent. In diagnosis we have the connecting channels, the urine and the general appearance. Watch the channels, examine the urine, and diagnosing from the general appearance, let the result coincide. If you are sure you see signs of death, urge him to the practice of virtue. If he is cut off by karmic effects, ritual and diagnosis are useless. If it is certain his time of death has come, Even food which should nourish the body may be his life’s enemy. But if it is not such a case, and he suffers from an accident or a sudden disease, you will save him by treatment and medicine.
gal te thabs mkhas lag len dang // goms 'dris ga dar ma song na // sman du mi 'gro dug du 'gro //
If your skill and cleverness of method have not been perfected by practice, you will not produce medicine, but poison.

nad pa mi sos 'chi yun thung // de phyir thabs mkhas lag len gces // de ltar mo rtsis dpyad gto bzhi // spyod dang 'jug dang rtogs pa yis // sems can 'gro la phan par bya // phya gshen legs rgyal thugs la zhog // ces gsungs so /

You will not cure the sick man and he will die before long. So skill and cleverness of method are very important. So by practising, setting about and understanding these four, sortilege, astrological calculation, ritual and diagnosis, living beings must be benefited. Keep this in mind, O Phya-gshen Legs-rgyal. This is what he said.
II. SNANG GSHEN GYI THEG PA

d.crumb: II. shen of the visual world

f.d: II. THE WAY OF THE SHEN OF THE VISUAL WORLD
[vol. kha, f. 197a5 onwards]
de la ston pas bka' stsal pa / nyon cig snang gshen gtsug phud nyon / snang gshen theg pa'i bon sgo la // spyi ru rnam pa bzhi yin te //
At that the Teacher said: Listen, sNang-gshen gTsug-phud, listen! As for the Bon Portal of the Way of the Shen of the Visual World, there are in general four types:
chab nag chu bo sel gyi sgo // chab dkar 'dre dang sri yi sgo // 'phan yul mnyam brje glud kyi sgo // dpon gsas phywa gnyan gto yi sgo //

(1) the ‘Black Waters’, the river, the portal of exorcism, (2) the ‘White Waters’, the portal of demons and vampires, (3) 'Phan-yul, the portal of ransom by equal exchange, (4) the ‘Master Sage’, the portal of Ritual for fates and furies.

de ltar gyer sgo bzhi las su // gcong brgyad skad kyis brda sprad nas // tshul dang lugs bzhin spyod pa na // snang ni snang zhing srid pa snang // gshen ni de dag 'dul bas gshen // snang gshen theg pa'i [197b] bon sgo yis // 'gro ba kha lo bsgyur ba'o // snang gshen gtsug phud thugs la zhog // ces gsungs so /

Thus in this matter of the four portals of incantation, indicating the terms with the sound of the eight ululations, and performing according to form and to pattern, the Visual World is so called because it is visible and existing, and the Shen is referred to as Shen because he overcomes it. By this means one guides living beings, sNang-gsen gTsug-phud, keep that in mind. So he spoke.

de la yang gsol pa / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ston pa lags // de ltar snang gshen theg pa las // gyer sgo bzhi ru gsungs pa yi // de yi dbye ba ci ltar lags // de la gcong brgyad skad sbyar nas // skad kyi rnam grangs ci ltar lags // bdag cag rig pa'i blo rtsal zhan // zhib tu dbye nas bka' bstsal 'tshal // zhes gsol to /

He was questioned again: O Teacher, who know everything! Thus in the Shen Way of the Visual World There are four doors of incantation, you have told us. What is the difference between them? Then with reference to the sounds of the eight ululations, What is the list of these sounds. We are weak in intellectual understanding. We beg you to tell us by explaining carefully. Thus they asked him,
de la rgyal bus bka' stsal pa / nyon cig snang gshen gtsug phud dang / 'dus pa'i 'khor rnams thams cad kun // ma yengs dbang po brtan par nyon //
and the Prince replied: Listen, sNang-gshen gTsug-phud and all you who have gathered as his entourage. Listen with senses unwavering and fixed.

snang gshen theg pa'i sgo bzhi la // thog mar chab nag sel gyi sgo // de la rnam pa bzhi yin te // chab nag chu bo gzhung chen las // smrang rgyud chu bzhi gyes pa de // zad pa med pa'i rgya mtsho 'dra // rgyun chad med pa chu bo 'dra //

Among the four portals of the Shen Way of the Visual World, (1) first (we take) the Black Waters, the portal of exorcism. This has four parts. From the great lore of the Black Waters four rivers separate themselves as streams of exposition. It is like the inexhaustible ocean. It is like a continuously flowing river.
'gro la phan pa char pa 'dra // gar bsgyur bde ba chu phran 'dra // skye 'gro gso ba lu ma 'dra // 'phel kha chu bo 'brug pa 'dra // yag pa lo tog legs pa 'dra //

It is like rain which benefits living beings. It is like a stream which may be easily directed anywhere. It is like a spring that succours living beings. It is like a rising flood that gushes forth. It is like a fine and good harvest.
1a
1a
srid pa smrang chen sel gyi gzhung // thug khar gnyan po lha'i gzhung // sgra bla wer ma dpa' khrom gzhung // srid pa mi'u rgyud kyi gzhung // de chab nag chu bo gzhung bzhi yin //

(1a) The lore of exorcism—the great exposition of existence, (1b) the lore of the gods—of the Thug-khar Furies, (1c) the lore of the genies—of the hero-gathering of the Wer-ma Genies (1d) the lore of the original human stream of existence, these are the four river-like lores of the Black Waters.

de la so sor gyes pa las // sel la rnam pa bcu gnyis te // rtsa dkar 'phel ba'i yar sel bzhi // rtsa nag 'grib pa'i mar sel [dang] bzhi // mnyam nyid bsor ba'i bar sel bzhi // rtsa dkar 'phel ba'i [198a] yar sel la // gang la gang 'dul bon yin pas // sems can blo ngos gsum dang sbyar // smang la 'phen par 'dod pa la // g.yung drung srid pa 'phel sel bya // dbul la phyug par 'dod pa la // srid pa ba gar gyen sel bya // khas nyan btsan por 'dod pa la // klung rta dar ba'i gar sel bya // chung la che bar 'dod pa la // rgyal gyi khri 'phang gong sel bya // rtsa nag 'grib pa'i mar sel la // rmang ste chad la khad pa la // 'dre dgu sri bcu'i thur sel bya // dbul te ltog la khad pa la // srid pa'i sa bdag thur sel bya // rlag ste nyes la khad pa la // byur dang mi la'i chu sel bya // dma' ste lhung la khad pa la // mtho ru mi ster nyen sel bya // mnyam nyid bsor ba'i bar sel la // lha klu gnyan dang 'gras pa na // lha mi bar gyi dbyen sel bya //

(1a) Separating from each other, there are twelve kinds of exorcism: the four upward exorcisms of increase of the white channel, the four downward exorcisms of decrease of the black channel, the four intermediate exorcisms of transposing equivalents. As for the upward exorcisms of increase of the white channel, they are the bon that overcomes whatsoever (opposes) anything, and they should be fitted to the three dispositions of beings. If it is a matter of prospering the feeble, perform the increase exorcism of swastika being. If it is a matter of bringing wealth to replace poverty, perform the upward exorcism of existence in the ‘universal womb’. If you want strength instead of weakness, perform the strong exorcism of the potent klung-rta. If you want greatness instead of being small, perform the top exorcism of the royal throne. As for the downward exorcisms of decrease of the black channel: if being feeble, one is near one’s end, perform the downward exorcism of the nine demons and the ten vampires. If being poor, one is near to hunger, perform the downward exorcism of the local gods of the phenomenal world. If being lost, one is near to harm, perform the water exorcism of byur and mi-la. If being down, one is near to falling, perform the exorcism of the calamity which does not let you go higher. As for the four intermediate exorcisms by transposing equivalents: if one is at enmity with gods, serpents and furies, perform the exorcism of this dissension of gods, men and intermediate beings.

shin tu gag nyen rtsub pa la // bya dmar mtshal bu'i gag sel bya // sme mnol mi gtsang 'bag pa la // dme mug nal gyi btsog sel bya // mi mthun pra ltas ngan pa la // ltas ngen bzlog pa'i than sel bya //

In the case of severe danger from an impediment, perform the exorcism of the impediment of the Red Bird Vermilion. In the case of defilement from murder, adultery or other impurity, perform the exorcism of this filth of murder, of fatherless child or of incest. In the case of bad signs from unfavourable prognostics, perform the exorcism of evil for the overpowering of evil signs.

de ltar gzhung chen bcu gnyis la // sngon srid pa gang gis dar ba yi'i // re re la yang bcu re ste // srid pa'i dpe srol re dang sbyar // dpe srol re la sel sgo re // de la srid pa smrang gzhung re // sel sgo brgya dang nyi shu [re] dbye // de la skad kyi gcang brgyad sbyar // dang po srid pa gsum po las // gtsang sme blang dor bzhen 'debs pa // stag mo ngar ba'i gcong las drang // de nas sel gyi smrang gyer ba'i // [198b] bya khyi rta yi gcong las drang // bya skad sna tshogs 'gyur ba yin // khyi skad zug dang ngur ba yin // rta skad 'tsher dang snyan pa yin // gcong gi snyan ngag legs par bya //

Likewise for the twelve great lores which spread forth originally, for each of them there are ten again, with an original archetype associated with each one, and a way of exorcism for each archetype. So for each original lore of exposition there is subdivision into 120 ways of exorcism, and with these are associated the eight ululations of sound. First in the case of the three originals for urging the acceptance of purity and rejection of defilement, effect the ululation of the growling tigress. Then for the incantation of the exposition of exorcism, effect the ululation of bird and dog and horse. There are various variable sounds of birds. The sound of the dog is barking or growling. The sound of the horse is neighing and pleasant. The utterance of ululations must be done well.

spyir yang 'gro drug sems can rnams // sdug bsngal nyon mongs gdung ba la // nyon mongs nad rnams sel ba dang // bde ba'i don dang ldan pa dang // thabs dang thugs rje mi 'gag phyir // gang la bon sgo gang 'dul bstan // skyon yon legs nyes ma shes dang // gtsang sme blang dor ma phyed pas // mi dge nyes pa'i gzhi ma byung //

In general when beings of the Six Spheres are tormented with the afflictions of suffering, in order to exorcise the diseases of their afflictions, and to provide them with the substance of happiness, and so that there should be no end of method and compassion, show to whomever it is the bon way that quells whatsoever it is. If one does not know harm from benefit and good from evil, or distinguish purity from defilement and acceptance from rejection, a basis for non-virtue and evil will result.

dme dang mug dang nal dang btsog // than dang ltas ngan byur yug 'bag // thab dang mkhon dang dbar la sogs // de dag lha yi spyan la phog // gtsang ris lha la mnol phog pas // gzhi gnas mnga' dbang yul sa mnol // de yi grib chags kha rlangs rnams // 'gro ba mi yi tshogs la phog // 'jig rten zhing 'dir dbul 'phongs dang // nad dang mu ge 'khrugs pa dang // mi bde sdug bsngal sna tshogs 'byung //

The impurities of murder, fatherless child, incest, evils, bad signs, and defiling misfortunes, defilement of the hearth, of animosity, anger and the rest, they strike the eyes of the gods. If defilement touches the gods of the Pure Abode, the domains of the Lords of the Soil are defiled. The vapours of their defilement strikes upon the company of human beings, and in this world region poverty, disease, famine, disturbances, unhappiness and sufferings of all kinds arise.

de dag bsang zhing dag pa dang // 'gro ba ma lus gso ba'i phyir // chab nag srid pa rgyud khog la // sel sgo shing lo 'dab rgyas byung // dkar nag bsal bas sel zhes bya // gtsang sme bsal bas sel zhes bya // sme mnol bsal bas sel zhes bya // dme mug bsal bas sel zhes bya // dbul 'phongs bsal bas sel zhes bya // 'gag pa bsal bas sel zhes bya // kag nyes bsal bas [199a] sel zhes bya //

In order to cleanse them and clear them away and in order to cure all beings, inside this original stream of the Black Waters there emerged the ways of exorcism spreading as branches, leaves and petals. They are known as exorcisms (viz. cleansers) because they cleanse the white and the black. They are known as exorcisms because they cleanse the pure from the foul. They are known as exorcisms, because they cleanse filth and impurity. They are known as exorcisms, because they cleanse the defilement of murder and of the fatherless child, They are known as exorcisms, because they remove poverty. They are known as exorcisms, because they remove obstructions. They are known as exorcisms, because they remove impediments and evils.
de la bya thabs 'di lta ste // gnas dang rdzas dang bca' gzhi dang // gyer dang tha ma rjes bzhi'o //
Now the method of operation is like this: (i) the place, (ii) the items and their arrangement, (iii) the incantation, and (iv) lastly the final part.
gnas ni mdo dang mdud la gtad // 'gying dang 'khyil dang dpal dang mdud // 'gying la rgyab gtad 'khyil par bca' // dpal la gong bstod mdud la 'bor //

As for the place, one must face towards the lower part of a valley and a cross-roads. (There must be) a lofty mountain, an amphitheatre (formed by surround-in cliffs), some good ground and some cross-roads. Turn your back to the lofty mountain and make preparations in the amphitheatre. As good ground a raised place is commendable, and at the cross-roads you must leave (your ransom-offerings).
rdzas ni bzang zhing sna tshogs dang // bya spu bal tshon shel tshigs dang // 'dod 'jo'i ba dang 'dab chags bya // sprel dkar klong grum ba dkar dang // bya ma byel bu la sogs bsag //

The items should be good ones and various: birds’ feathers, coloured wool, sacrificial barley, a wish-granting cow and feathery fowl, a white monkey, a badger, and a white cow, a bat, and other such things should be gathered together.
gzhan yang 'bru sna'i mchod pa dang // dkar mngar sha khrag 'dod yon rdzas // phun sum tshogs pa'i yo byad bsag //

Furthermore an offering of green barley, the three milk-products, the three sweet offerings, flesh and blood, and other desirable offerings, these are the excellent necessaries to be gathered together.

srid pa'i sel ra gnyen por bskos // yar la yod kyi ral chen gsum // mar la med pa'i lung chen gsum // bar na lha mi 'tshog pa'i gnas // lha gzhi dkar po'i steng du ni // sngon mo nas kyi sbran ma blug // lha mda' sgro dkar rten la gzugs // sel bsal mchod pa'i yo byad bshams // srid pa'i sel bon smra chen gyis // dbu la 'gying ba'i thod kyang bcing //

Set up as an aid the original exorcizing ring. Above the three great high vales of being, below the three great low vales of non-being, in between the place where gods and men may come together, (here) on the white sacred mat place the 'sprinklings’ of green barley. Set up as symbol the divine arrow with the white feather. Prepare the necessaries for offering to the pure divinities of the exorcizing rite. The great speaker of the original exorcizing bon binds the turban on his head.

zhal na skyem pa'i skyems yang gsol // phyag na 'bul ba'i yon kyang 'bul // zhal nas gcong gis smrang kyang gyer // mi 'gro yas stags spang bar bya // smrang ni zhib la rgyas par bya // chab nag nus pa smrang la 'byung // chab dkar nus pa sngags la 'byung // dpon gsas nus pa rin chen yin // de phyir chab nag smrang gis gtso // rjes kyi bya ba yag [199b] ka brjod // sems can 'gro la sman par mdzod // 'gro ba gang la gang phan gyis // sems bskyed gzhi ma ldan par gces // snang gshen gtsug phud thugs la zhog // ces gsungs so /

In his mouth he receives the draught that is to be drunk. In his hand he offers the thing that is to be offered. With his voice he intones the exposition using ululations. Unsuitable ritual items must be avoided. The exposition must be done carefully in full. The potency of the ‘Black Waters’ emerges in the exposition. The potency of the ‘White Waters’ emerges in the spells. The potency of the Master-Sages is a gem. So for the ‘Black Waters’ exposition is the most important thing. As the final part recite the blessing. Do good to living beings. Do whatever is of benefit to them. It is essential to raise your Thought towards Enlightenment as the basis (of your action). sNang-gshen gTsug-phud, keep this in mind. This is what he said.
1b
1b
nyon cig snang gshen gtsug phud nyon // gnyis pa thug khar lha gzhung la // 'gro drug sems can thams cad ni // mi bde sdug bsngal gdung ba la // thug khar lha yi dmag tshogs brngan //

Listen, sNan-gsen gTsug-phud, listen! (1b) Secondly as for the sacred lore of Thug-khar, all the beings of the Six Spheres, when afflicted with unhappiness and suffering, should requite the army of the Thug-khar gods.
de la rnam pa bzhi yin te // ye srid lha gzhung dkar po dang // ye dbang gnyan gzhung khra bo dang // ye 'dul dmag gzhung nag po gsum //

Of these there are four [sic] kinds: the White Lore of the Gods of eternal existence, the Dappled Lore of the Furies of eternal power, the Black Lore of the Armies of eternal subjugation, these are the three.

thog mar lha gzhung dkar po la // lha 'khor gsum brgya drug cu yod // bar pa gnyan gzhung khra bo la // lha 'khor gnyis brgya lnga bcu yod // tha ma dmag gzhung nag po la // lha 'khor brgya dang rtsa brgyad yod //

First in the White Lore of the Gods there is an entourage of 360 gods. Secondly in the Dappled Lore of the Furies there is an entourage of 250 gods. Lastly in the Black Lore of the Armies there is an entourage of 108 gods.

de gsum gcig tu dril ba yi // thug khar dgu khri gling mkhar yin // dgu khri gling mkhar nam mkha'i rdzong // nam mkha' yangs pa'i gsas mthong na // rang grub rin chen sprul pa'i mkhar // rmeng gzhi rin chen gser la byas // logs bzhi lo phrom bse la byas // zur bzhi sngo mnyen lcags la byas // sgo gzhi ba le dung la byas //

These three (sets) gathered together are the Thug-khar ‘Island Citadel of the 90,000’. The ‘Island Citadel of the 90,000’ is a sky-fort. In the divine vault of the spacious sky is a self-produced magic citadel of gems. Its four foundation-supports are made of gems and gold. Its four walls are made of burnished copper. Its four corners are made of supple steel. Its four doors are made of ba-le shells.

kha bad mtsho ro g.yu la byas // rdo rje bzhin gyi brtan cig yod // ri bo bzhin gyi brjid cig yod // nam mkha' bzhin gyi gsal cig yod // bar snang bzhin gyi yang cig yod // nyi ma bzhin gyi dro cig yod // zla ba bzhin gyi bsil [200a] cig yod // lho sprin bzhin gyi phon cig yod // rgyu skar bzhin gyi bkrag cig yod // yod pa ye yod mtshams na yod // bzung ba thug khar lha yis bzung //

Its protruding eaves are made of turquoise. It is firm as a powerbolt (vajra). It is magnificent as a mountain. It is translucent as the sky. It is spacious as the atmosphere. It is glowing as the sun. It is cool as the moon. It is dense as a cloud from the south. It is brilliant as the constellations. As for its existence, it exists at the limit of eternal existence. As for those who hold it, it is held by the Thug-khar gods.

mkhar de srid pa phyin cad nas // da lta ding sangs phan chad la // g.yung drung bstan pa nyams ma myong // lha mi'i dbu 'phang dma' ma myong // sdang ba'i dgra bos brgol ma myong // gnod pa'i bgegs kyis tshugs mi srid //

From the time that that citadel came into being up until the present time, the swastika doctrine has experienced no weakening, the dignity of gods and men has experienced no abasement, there has been no opposition from hateful enemies, there has been no attack from harmful demons.

thug khar bu dgu yab dang bcu // dgung sman mched bdun yum dang brgyad // dgu khri dgu 'bum dmag dang bcas // 'phel chen yag ka brjod na dgos // shas chen dmag la chas na dgos // rgyug chen bya rdang bkyag na dgos // lha dmag dgra la bshig na dgos // rgyal po rgyal sa gnon na dgos // btsun mo rtsa dkar 'phel na dgos // blon po dar sa 'dzin na dgos // yo ma 'phel kha rtsi na dgos // de dgos pa'i do gal che brgyad yin //

The nine Thug-khar sons—with their father totalling ten, the seven celestial goddesses of medicine—with their mother totalling eight, together with their army 99,000 strong, when reciting a blessing for prosperity, we need them. Especially when going to war, we need them. When presenting the ‘bird-rack’ of the Great Runner, we need them. When the royal army would destroy the enemy, we need them. When the king would subdue the kingdom, we need them. When the queen would induce pregnancy, we need them. When the minister would gain influence, we need them. When we reckon prosperity by mares, we need them. These are the eight important times when we need them.

snang gshen srid pa'i bon po yis // rgyud las 'byung ba'i bon spyod cing // rigs su mchod pa'i lha bdar nas // sems can 'gro la phan gdag nas // thug khar lha rabs gzhung bzhi las // gyer dang bsgrub dang mchod brngan bkyag // gang du byed pa'i las ngo long // dben dang gtsang ma'i gnas nyid du // sme dang mnol ba ma phog par // gtsang ma'i sa la dkyil 'khor bzhengs // mchod pa'i rdzas dang yo byad bsham //

The bonpos of the original (way of the) Shen of the Visual World should perform the bon which comes by tradition, invoking the gods who are to be worshipped in such cases, and benefiting living beings. According to the fourfold lore of the divine Thug-khar lineage, they intone, they bring the divinity to their presence, and they make offerings of requital. Undertake the rite wherever it is to be done, in a lonely and clean place. Avoiding filth and impurity, lay out the magic circle on clean ground. Arrange the ritual items and necessaries.

ltag sha snying khrag dam rdzas bsag // mda' dar me long rin chen dang // bla bre 'phan gdugs rgyal mtshan dang // zur gsum bshos gtsang [200b] phud kyis mchod // rnga gshang dung gling skad kyis 'bod // dri zhim ngad ldan shul gyis mtshon // tshig bshad gtang rag dbyangs kyis bkrol // thugs kyi snying po 'dzab nas bgrang // sku gsung yon tan sgo nas bstod // 'phrin las rnam bzhi drag tu bcol // g.yung drung bstan pa dar bar bcol // gshen rab dbu 'phang mtho bar bcol // snang srid bskos la 'debs par bcol // 'byung ba cha la 'bebs par bcol // kha drag dar la che bar bcol // bdud srin log pa 'dul bar bcol // 'dre srin cham la 'bebs par bcol //

Accumulate flesh from the nape of the neck, blood from the heart, the sacred items, the arrow with silk band, mirror and gem (all attached), the canopy, the ceremonial umbrella, the banner of victory, and make a first offering with the three-cornered sacrificial cake. Call with the sound of drum, flat bell, conch and shawm. Show the way with the passage of sweet-smelling incense. Intone the verses according to the chant of the ceremony. Repeat according to number the essential spell (that relates to the divinity’s) Mind. Praise him according to his Body, his Speech and his Qualities. Urge him strongly to fourfold Action. Urge him to spread the Swastika doctrine. Urge him to raise the dignity of the best of Shen. Urge him to bring order into the phenomenal world. Urge him to bring the elements into a proper balance. Urge him to increase and to spread our might. Urge him to quell perverse demons. Urge him to bring devils to subjection.
de ltar bsgrub dang las la sbyor // gang du byed pa'i las ka ni // bka' dang gzhung bzhin spyod par bya //
Thus summoning him and setting him to work, wherever any rite is to be performed, it must be done according to tradition and lore.
ma brtags ma gzab tho co dang // mthong mthong yas dang thos thos bon // dran dran glu ru len mi bya //
Thoughtless and careless capriciousness, items just as one sees them, bon just as one hears it, chants just as one remembers them, such must not be made use of.
lar yang thug khar lha gzhung la // gtsang sme ma 'dres dag par bya // 'jig rten lha tshog gtsang la dga' // gtsang la dga' zhing sme la 'jigs //
But in this sacred lore of Thug-khar do not mingle impurity with purity. Be clean. The gods of this world rejoice in purity. Rejoicing in purity, they fear impurity.

de ltar gtsang sme ma 'dres pa // lung nas 'byung bzhin spyad pa na // bstan pa chags pa'i dar so la // med la yod par srid pa dang // de yang thug khar lha yi drin // stong la gang bar 'phel ba dang // de yang thug khar lha yi drin // 'jig la chags par srid pa dang // de yang thug khar lha yi drin // dman la mtho bar 'gro ba dang // de yang thug khar lha yi drin // dbul la phyug par srid pa dang // de yang thug khar lha yi drin //

Thus if you do not mingle impurity with purity and perform the rite as it is prescribed, where the doctrine spreads in the place of its arising, this coming into being where there was nothing before, this too is by favour of the Thug-khar gods. Prosperity which turns emptiness into fullness, this too is by favour of the Thug-khar gods. Destruction which is turned into production, this too is by favour of the Thug-khar gods. Baseness which is turned into high rank, this too is by favour of the Thug-khar gods. Poverty which is turned into wealth, this too is by favour of the Thug-khar gods.

rmang la 'phan par srid pa dang // de yang thug khar lha yi drin // khas nyan dpa' bar 'gro ba dang // rgyal khams mnga' ris dar ba dang // de yang thug khar lha yi drin // nad yams 'khrugs [201a] pa zhi ba dang // de yang thug khar lha yi drin // bkra shis dge rtags 'phel ba dang // de yang thug khar lha yi drin // snang srid dge la mos pa dang // de yang thug khar lha yi drin //

Feebleness which is turned into prosperity, this too is by favour of the Thug-khar gods. Weakness which is turned into heroism, this too is by favour of the Thug-khar gods. Extension of the spheres of influence of the kingdom, this too is by favour of the Thug-khar gods. The stilling of epidemics and disturbances, this too is by favour of the Thug-khar gods. Increase of blessings and signs for the good, this too is by favour of the Thug-khar gods. That the everyday world should take delight in good, this too is by favour of the Thug-khar gods.
de phyir thug khar gnyen par brtsi // kun rdzob mtshan ma dngos por bden // sems can 'gro la sman par 'gyur // snang srid dga' bde 'phel bar 'gyur //

Therefore you should reckon the Thug-khar as your aid. The outward signs (of the phenomenal world which belong to the sphere) of relative truth are true (in so far) as (they are) things, and these will be of benefit to living beings. They increase the joy and happiness of everyday existence.
don dam stong pa nyid du bden // 'gro ba thar lam 'byed par 'gyur //
Absolute truth is true (in so far) as (it refers to) the Void. It opens the way of salvation for living beings.

mthar yang don dam bden pa dang // kun rdzob mtshan ma'i bden pa dang // bden pa gnyis po dor mnyam nas // so so ma yin tha mi dad // gnyis su med cing byar med de // mnyam pa nyid kyi don rtogs na // bdag kyang mkha' la rtse ru chib // gzhan yang dbyings su lhun gyis grub // snang gshen gtsug phud thugs la zhog // sems can 'gro la smin par mdzod // ces gsungs so /

In the final analysis absolute truth and the truth of relative outward signs, when both truths are paired together, they are not separate and there is no difference. They are not two and must not be made (into two). If one understands the meaning of Sameness, one reaches the top oneself, and others in the whole sphere are spontaneously perfected. sNang-gshen gTsug-phud, keep this in mind, and bring all beings to a state of ripeness.
yang ston pas bka' stsal pa / nyon cig snang gshen gtsug phud nyon //
Again the Teacher said: Listen, sNang-gshen gTsug-phud, listen.
1c
1c

gsum pa sgra bla'i dpa' khrom la // 'gro drug sems can thams cad ni // sdug bsngal nyon mongs gdung ba dang // kag nyen 'phrag dog rtsub pa dang // bstan pa dar rgyas chung ba dang // pha rol dgra ru lang ba dang // klung rta dbang thang rgud pa dang // g.yul so tshur la lang ba na // sgra bla wer ma'i dpa' khrom bkyag

(1c) Thirdly, as for the hero-gathering of the Genies, all living beings of the Six Spheres, when they are tormented with the afflictions of suffering, or troubled with impediments and jealousies, when the spread of the doctrine diminishes, and outsiders rise up as enemies, when well-being and influence are in decline, and the battle-ground comes back upon one, then one must make offering to the hero-gathering of the Wer-ma Genies.
mgon po bya rdang srung ma bsten // cang seng shug mgon gnyan po brngan // kun rdzob bden pa yin pas gtso //
One must trust in the Defender ‘Bird-Rack’ as one’s guardian, and one must requite the Cang-seng and the Shug-mgon Furies. As it concerns relative truth, these are very important.
de yang rnam pa bzhi yin te // sgra bla gnyan dang wer ma rje // cang seng gnyan dang shug mgon rdzi // gzhun chen bzhi ru shes par bya //
These too are of four kinds: (i) the Genie-Furies, (ii) the Wer-ma Lords, (iii) the Cang-seng Furies, (iv) the Shug-mgon Leaders. They are thus to be known as four great lores.
de yang dang po sgra bla la // ye srid 'phrul gyi sgra bla dang // ye rje smon pa'i sgra bla dang // ye dbang mthu yi [201b] sgra bla gsum //
(i) So first as for the Genies, they are of three kinds: (a) the Ye-srid-'phrul Genies, (b) the Ye-rje-smon-pa Genies, (c) the Ye-dbang-mthu Genies.

dang po ye srid sgra bla la // sgra bla khyung nag ral chen byung // sgra bla khyung nag ral chen la // ye mkhyen sgra bla'i dmag tshogs grol // spyi gtsug nor bu rin chen la // sgra bla yid bzhin lha dbang srid // khyung ru g.yas dang g.yon pa la // sgra bla lha gsas dar ma srid // rna ba g.yas dang g.yon pa la // sgra bla ngar chen g.yu 'brug srid // spyan mig g.yas dang g.yon pa la // sgra bla yod khams kun gsal srid // khyung mchu thur du bgrad pa la // sgra bla khyung nag sha zan srid // sgro chen sum brgya drug cu la // sgra bla sum brgya drug cu srid // thel shog gser gyi 'dab ma la // sgra bla nyi khri dgu 'bum srid // khyung sder sa la 'jum pa la // sgra bla klu 'dul khyung chen srid // sngon srid pa chags pa'i ru ma la // ye nas srid pa chags pa'i sgra bla yin //

Firstly as for (a) the Ye-srid-'phrul Genies, there appeared the Genie ‘Black Khyung Great Mane’. From ‘Black Khyung Great Mane’ there came the army of Ye-mkhyen sgra-bla. From the precious gem of the top (of the Khyung’s head) came the Genie Yid-bzhin-lha-dbang (Wish-granting-divine-power). From the right and left horns of the Khyung came the Genie Lha-gsas-dar-ma (Divine-manhood). From its right and left ears came the Genie Ngar-chen g.yu-'brug (Great-strength-turquoise-dragon). From its right and left eyes came the Genie Yod-khams-kun-gsal (Quite-purifying-existence). From the Khyung’s beak which gaped wide downwards came the Genie Khyung-nag-sha-zan (Black Khyung Flesh-Eater). From its 360 great feathers came 360 Genies. From the small feathers of its golden down came 29,000 Genies. From the Khyung’s claws contracted earthwards came the Genie Klu-'dul-khyung-chen (Great Khyung Serpent-Subduer). These are the Genies who appeared originally from the beginning at the source of the appearance of existence.

de 'og ye rje smon pa la // srid pa chags pa'i gzhi ma dang // mi rgyud grol ba'i ru ma ru // g.yas kyi gser ri g.yu lung dang // g.yon gyi dung ri mchong lung dang // thad kyi shel brag 'od mtsho las // sgra bla smon pa'i seng gsum srid //

Next as for (b) the Ye-rje-smon-pa Genies: at the foundation of the appearance of existence and at the source of the coming of the lineage of men, from the Turquoise Vale by the Golden Mountain on the right and the Chalcedony Vale by the Conch-coloured Mountain on the left, and the Lake of Light by the Crystal Crag straight ahead there came the three lions of the sMon-pa Genies.
de la srid cing grol ba yi // mi rgyud de la sgra bla re // sgra bla re la lha dmag re // lha dmag re la kha 'dzin re // kha 'dzin re la rdzi bu re // de ye rje smon pa'i sgra bla yin //

As they came forth into existence, there was a Genie for each lineage of men, and for each Genie there was a divine army, and for each army there was an overseer, and for each overseer a leader. These are the Ye-rje~smon-pa Genies.

de 'og ye gshen dbang rdzogs kyis // srid pa rgyud kyi lha bdar zhing // dung dung mchod mchod bsten bsten nas // ngar ngar dgra la rbad pa yi // sgra bla dra ma gzhung chen bzhi // rang bzhin [202a] sprul pa 'phrul gyi gzhung // rang grub rin chen mkhar gyi gzhung // rin chen sme ba gling gi gzhung // rang 'byung dra ma nyag gcig gzhung // de sgra bla dra ma gzhung bzhi yin // dra ma mched dgu'i dmag dang chas // ye dbang mthu'i sgra bla yin //

Next (c) Ye-gshen-dbang-rdzogs, invoking the gods of the original tradition, persistently making offerings and giving instructions, fiercely he sets them upon the enemy, the Dra-ma Genies according to their four great lores: the lore of the Magic of ‘Personal Manifestation’, the lore of the Citadel of ‘Self-Manifesting Gems’, the lore of the Region of the Precious sMe-ba, the single lore of the ‘Self-Originating Dra-ma’. The nine Dra-ma brothers together with their armies are the Ye-dbang-mthu Genies.

wer ma'i dpa' khrom gzhung bzhi yod // sngon lha gsas dbal gsum rdzu 'phrul las // nam mkha' stong pa'i dbyings rum nas // rin chen sna lnga'i sgo nga cig // rang bzhin shugs kyis brdol ba las // sgong shun skyob pa'i go ru srid // bdar sha srung ba'i mtshon du srid // sgong chu dpa' ba'i ngar chur srid // sgong pri 'khra ba'i mkhar du srid // khro chu dmu rdzong mun gyi mkhar // gsal ba nyi ma'i kha 'od 'phrog //

(ii) There are four lores of the hero-gathering of Wer-ma. Formerly by the magical powers of the Gods, the gSas and the dBal from the celestial womb of the empty sky an egg (formed) of the five precious gems burst open by its own innate force. From it the shell became protecting armour, the tegument became defending weapons, the white became a strength-potion for heroes, the inner skin became a citadel for them to dwell in. The dark citadel Khro-chu-dmu-rdzong so bright was it, it stole the sun’s light.

sgo nga nang gi snying po las // rdzu 'phrul mi pho gcig du srid // seng ge'i mgo la dbyi yi rna // 'khro ba'i gdong la glang chen sna // chu srin zhal la rgya stag mche // ral gri'i rkang la chu gri gshog // bya khyung dar ma'i rwa dbal la // yid bzhin nor bu'i dbu brgyan can //

From the very inner part of the egg there came a man of magical powers. He had the head of a lion and the ears of a lynx, a fierce face and an elephant’s nose, a crocodile’s mouth and a tiger’s fangs, feet like swords, and feathers like sabres, and between the horns of the vigorous bird Khyung, he had as his head-adornment a wish-granting gem.
de la ming 'dogs ming med pa // ye gshen dbang rdzogs mthu yis bsgrubs // dpa' chen wer ma nyi nya zhes //
No name was given him, so he had no name, but Ye-gshen-dbang-rdzogs conjured him with magical force, and gave him the name ‘Great Hero Wer-ma Nyi-nya’.
mthu ldan yongs kyi thu bo po // bon dang gshen gyi bstan pa bsrung // dgra dang bgegs kyi dpung tshogs gzhom // dkar dang dge ba'i sdong grogs mdzad //
He is the foremost of all the powerful ones, protecting the doctrines of Bon and of Shen, overcoming the hordes of foes and opponents, acting as friends of goodness and virtue.

de la wer ma gzhung bzhi grol // wer ma lha dang bsdebs pa las // lha yi wer ma bdud 'dul srid // wer ma gnyan dang bsdebs pa la // gnyen gyi wer ma dgra 'dul [202b] grol // wer ma khyung dang bsdebs pa la // khyung gi wer ma klu 'dul grol // wer ma seng dang bsdebs pa la // dpa' 'dul wer ma mched gsum grol // wer ma dpa' ba'i dpa' khrom grol // dmag tshogs dgu khri dgu 'bum grol //

From him are derived Wer-ma according to four lores. The Wer-ma united with gods, and so the God-Wer-ma, subduers of demons, were produced. The Wer-ma united with Furies, and so the Fury-Wer-ma, subduers of foes, were produced. The Wer-ma united with Khyung, and so the Khyung-Wer-ma, subduers of serpents, were produced. The Wer-ma united with lions, and so the Three Brothers, the Wer-ma hero-subduers, were produced. There was produced the hero-gathering of Wer-ma heroes. There was produced the army 99,000 strong.

lha la grol zhing gsas la chad // dbal la 'dra zhing bdud la 'tshig // gang la yang ni 'phrag dog cing // kun thub gang yang 'jigs pa med // tsha dbal 'joms shing grang dbal len // gang gis mi shig nam mkha'i mkhar // kun gyis mi 'jigs wer ma'i sku // g.yung drung bon gyi bstan pa'i srog // dgra bgegs 'dul ba'i gnyen por byung // de wer ma dpa' ba'i gzhung bzhi yin //

Produced from gods, born from gSas, equal to dBal, destroyers of demons, envious of everyone, able to do everything, fearing no one, destroying the Extreme (dBal) of Heat, seizing the Extreme (dBal) of Cold. Their Sky-Citadel, no one can destroy, they fear nothing, these Wer-ma forms. They are the life of the doctrine of Swastika Bon, and have come as aids for the subjugation of foes and obstructions. These are the four lores of the Wer-ma Heroes.
cang seng gnyan la gzhung bzhi yod // byes thub dpa' bo spun drug yod // gzhis srung khra mo rdzong drug yod // cang seng 'gron yag bcu gsum yod // lam lha gnyan po mched brgyad yod //

(iii) There are four lores of the Cang-seng Furies: the six brother-heroes capable of travel, the six ‘chequered’ castles which protect the estate, the thirteen Can-sen who are good at wayfaring, and the eight brother-furies who are gods of the road.
shugs mgon rdzi bu bcu gsum ste // kha drag srid pa'i shugs mgon la // shug mgon brgya dang rtsa brgyad grol //
(iv) There are thirteen Shug-mgon Leaders, and from these Shug-mgon of the ‘generations of might’ there were produced 108 Shug-mgon.
de yang srid pa'i dpe srol la // srid pa re la shug mgon re // de la smrang dang cho rabs re //
As for the archetypes of the generations, to each generation there was a Shug-mgon, and for each there was an exposition and a parental lineage.
de ltar sgra bla wer ma'i dmag // cang seng gnyan dang shug mgon rdzi // mgon po bya rdang srung ma ste //
Thus we have (i) the Genies, (ii) the army of Wer-ma, (iii) the Cang-seng Furies, and (iv) the Shug-mgon Leaders, and this Defender ‘Bird-Rack’, who is our guardian.

bsten ni dkar gsum phud kyis bsten // gsol ni dmar gsum don gyis gsol // mchod ni bdud rtsi sman gyis mchod // dgra sdang 'dul ba'i gnyen por mchod // bstan pa srung ba'i srung mar mchod // mda' mdung ral gri rten du 'dzugs // [203a] gser g.yu rin chen rten du 'dzugs // sgra bla dpa' yi mnga' yang gsol // bya bon bcu gsum 'phrin yang bskyol // srid pa'i bon pos smrang yang bkrol // rgyug chen mgon po'i bya rdang bkyag // rin chen sna lnga'i gsas mkhar brdzeg // nge ltar dpa' khrom dmag gi gzhung // 'jig rten bde la bkod pa dang // snang srid kha yo bsnyom pa'i phyir // kun rdzob bden pa'i don du phob // de yang bstan pa'i cha las su // rgyu yi theg pa zur 'degs tsam // rang bas gzhan don gtsor byed cing // sems can 'gro la smin pa dang // bstan pa'i don du ched bsam nas // don la mi gol 'jug sgo'i lam // 'jig rten zhing khams bde skyid dang // bsod nams dge ba shugs kyis 'phel // snang gshen gtsug phud thugs la zhog // sems can 'gro la sman par mdzod // ces gsungs so /

They must be attended with offerings of the three milk-products. They must be made offerings with the substance of the three red products. They must be worshipped with elixir and medicament. They must be worshipped as an aid for subduing hateful foes. They must be worshipped as guardians who will guard the doctrine. One sets up as symbols the arrow, the spear and the sword. One sets up as symbols gold and turquoise and precious stones. One beseeches the Genie-Heroes. One despatches the message by the Thirteen Birds of Bon, The original bonpos intone the exposition. One presents the ‘bird-rack’ of the Defender Great Runner. One builds a shrine of the five kinds of gems. Such is the lore of the hero-gathering-army. Arranging for happiness in this world and for smoothing what is awry in phenomenal existence, you turn to affairs of relative truth. As supplementary to the doctrine, the Vehicle of Cause is just a supporting help. But if you place more importance on others’ affairs than your own, and give your thoughts to perfecting living beings and advancing the doctrine, there will be no conflict in the matter, and it will be a way in, so that happiness, merit and goodness will increase automatically in the realm of this world. sNang-gshen gTsug-phud, keep this in mind! Do good to living beings! This is what he said.
1d
1d
yang rgyal bus bka' stsal pa / nyon cig snang gshen gtsug phud nyon //
Again the Prince said: Listen, sNang-gshen gTsug-phud, listen!

bzhi pa srid pa'i rgyud gzhung la // 'gro drug sems can thams cad 'di // dang por phyi snod chags pa nas // srid pa ci ltar srid pa dang // bskos pa ci ltar bskos pa dang // mi rgyud gang ltar grol ba dang // sngon gyi cho rabs bshad pa dang // bden pa'i smrang gis bkrol pa ste // sems can 'gro la sman pa yi // thabs kyi mtshan nyid rim pa rnams // mi shes rmongs pa bsal phyir bstan //

(1d) Fourthly, as for the lore of the stream of existence, (I speak of) all these sentient beings of the Six Spheres, how they originated in their origins when once the outer vessel (of the world) had appeared, how their ordering was ordered, how the human species was derived. With the telling of their first parental lineage and an explanation with the True Exposition of things, these duly ordered characteristics of methods are taught so that the obscurity of ignorance may be removed.
phyir yang thos bsam thams cad la // dang po nyan cing thos par gces // bar du thos shing go bar gces // tha ma brtag cing dpyad par gces // de nas grub pa'i 'bras bu 'byung //

de phyir 'jug sgo'i yan lag la // nang srid skye 'gro srog dbugs bsdus // nam mkha'i khyab tshad 'gro ba 'di // [203b] dang po ci ltar srid pa dang // bar du ci ltar gnas pa dang // tha ma ci ltar 'gyur ba yi // mtshan nyid bye brag thams cad 'di // shes par byed na blo kha 'byed // blo sgrom lde mig thos pas 'byed // mi shes lkugs pa yi ges smra // ma rig mun la rig pas gsal //

As for the parts of the introduction, these living beings of the phenomenal world, composite beings with life and with breath, equal in measure with the all-pervading sky, first how they originated, next how they remained constant, finally how they changed, if one knows all these different characteristics, one’s mind will be opened. Attentive listening is the key that opens the casket of the intellect. Words produce understanding where once there were ignorance and folly. Knowledge brings clarity where there was dark incomprehension.

de phyir thos shing dpyad pa (ni) // srid pa'i grol phug 'di dag la // dang po ma bsrid srid pa dang // rgyu mthun srid la 'byung srid dang // 'od gsal lha la grol ba dang // lha la mi ru chad pa dang //

So we listen and we diagnose. At these uttermost limits of the emanation of existence first the non-existent came into existence, and things emerged according to their species. They emerged from the gods of the Clear Light, as men they were born from gods.

mi la spyi sgos byed brag ste // ye smon rgyal po'i cho rabs las // bskal srid chags pa'i gzhung chen dang // smon lam mkhar gyi gling bzhi dang // srid pa mi'u'i rgyud 'bum dang // mtshon mgon sgra bla'i gzhung chen bzhi //

Regarding men, there are differences of a general and special kind. From the parental lineage of Ye-smon-rgyal-po came (i) the great lore of the birth of time-period and existence, (ii) the Four Continents of the ‘prayer-citadels’, (iii) the 100,000 species of human kind, (iv) the great lore of the genies, the armed guardians, four great lores in all.

de yang srid pa rgyud kyi bon // de srid bon la mi srid med // de phyir 'gro la mi sman med // mi sman med pas mi 'phan med // mi 'phan med pas mi dge med // de phyir dge ba ma lus pa // phan dang bsod pa'i rgyu la 'byung //

Furthermore as for this bon of the stream of existence, for this original bon there is nothing which is not possible. Thus there is nothing which does not benefit living beings. As there is nothing that does not benefit, there is nothing that does not further their interests. As there is nothing that does not further their interests, there is nothing that is not good. Thus unmitigated good arises from this beneficial and felicitous cause.
byang chub sems la bag yod na // sems can rnams la phan yon yod // sems can rnams la phan yod pas // de la grub pa'i mtha' yod do //
If one takes heed of the Thought of Enlightenment, there will be true benefit for living beings. By benefiting living beings the end in view is gained.

chab nag srid pa rgyud kyi bon // chu bo gzhung chen sde bzhi las // chu bran nyi shu rtsa bzhir gyes // de las so sor gyes pa ste // zad pa med cing 'phel ba med // 'phel ba med cing 'grib pa med // rtsi shing nags tshal grangs tsam gyes // 'gro drug sems can thams cad kun // chab nag chu bo rgyun gyis gso // snang gshen gtsug phud thugs la zhog // sems can 'gro la sman par mdzod // [204a] ces gsungs so /

This ‘Black Waters’ bon of the stream of existence has four main river courses which separate themselves into twenty-four rivulets. They cannot be exhausted and they do not increase. They do not increase, nor do they decrease. They spread as numerous as a forest of aromatic shrubs, and all beings of the Six Spheres are revitalized by the river-flow of the ‘Black Waters’. sNang-gshen gTsug-phud, keep this in mind, and do good to living beings. This is what he said.
de nas yang rgyal bus bka' stsal pa / nyon cig snang gshen gtsug phud dang // 'dus pa'i 'khor rnams thams cas kun // ma yengs dbang po brtan par nyon //
Then he spoke again. Listen, sNang-gshen gTsug-phud together with your whole entourage which is gathered together, listen with unwavering attention.
chab nag gyer, gyi sgo bzhi las // gnyis pa chab dkar srid pa'i sgo //
(2) Of the four portals of incantation of the ‘Black Waters’, the second is the original portal of the ‘White Waters’.

'gro drug sems can thams cad kun // skad cig bde ba mi ster ba // 'dre dgu sri bcu sdang ba la // 'dre dgu skyas kyi 'debs pa dang // sri bcu thur du gnon pa la // de yang rnam pa gnyis yin te // thabs dang thugs rje gnyis su'o //

Those who would not allow one moment’s happiness to all the living beings of the Six Spheres, the nine hateful demons and ten hateful vampires, for dispatching these nine demons and suppressing these ten vampires, there are two parts in the matter, namely Method and Compassion.
2a
2a
thog mar thabs la rnam pa gnyis // thabs kyis ngo nas bzung ba dang // thabs kyis rdzong 'debs bskyal ba'o //
Firstly Method has two parts, recognizing methodically, and dispatching methodically.

thabs kyis ngo nas 'dzin pa ni // pra ltas gsal ba'i me long thabs // rang gi shes rgyud drung sbyar nas // gnyis su med par bltas pa na // pha rol 'gro la gnod pa yi // srid rtse na rag yan chad kyi // ci srid gnod cing 'tshe ba rnams // ming dang mtshan ma ngos kyis zin //

As for recognizing methodically, one must combine one’s own experience with the method of the Mirror of Clear Prognostics, and then if you gaze one-pointedly, you can recognize the names and characteristics of those who harm other beings, whoever these may be who harm and torment from the peak of existence right down to hell.

de yang srid pa'i 'dre dgu ni // sngon srid [pa] ltang dbyal rnam pa gnyis // dbu btud shangs ma lhan pa ru // nam phyed dus su 'tshos pa la // yod med dge sdig rgyu 'bras dang // snang mun las kyi 'du byed kyis // lha bdud dkar nag srid pa'i phyir // skya bo bkrag med sgong gcig srid // sgo nga de nyid brdol pa las // sgo nga phyi yi shun pa la // gdon dang dri za'i rgyal khams srid // sgo nga bar gyi bdar sha la // ltas ngan brgyad cu rtsa gcig dang // ye 'brog sum brgya drug cu srid // sgong chu sa la bo ba la // nad rigs bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi srid // sgo nga de yi snying po la // gdon rigs sum brgya drug cu dang // rlangs pa [204b] bar du 'khyil ba la // rkyen rigs nyi khri chig stong srid // snyigs ma sa la phog pa la // bgegs figs stong phrag drug cu srid // gzeg ma kun du 'thor ba la // srid pa'i 'dre dgu sri bcu srid //

As for these nine original demons, in the first place they had two original parents. They bowed their heads together, but did not rub noses, and at midnight the offspring was born. By the combined effect of acts of right and wrong, good and evil, cause and effect, light and darkness, for the producing of gods and demons, whites and blacks, a greyish lustreless egg was produced. The egg burst open and the outer shell became the realms of evil spirits and parasites (gandharvas). The inner tegument of the egg became the eighty-one evil portents and the three hundred and sixty injuries. The white of the egg spilled on the ground and became the 404 kinds of disease. The centre of the egg became the 360 classes of evil spirits. The vapour that rose up in the air became the 21,000 accidental circumstances. The residue that fell on the ground became the 60,000 classes of obstructions. Small particles sprinkling everywhere became the nine original demons and ten vampires.

de rnams gang la gang 'dul gyi // thabs la mkhas pa'i skyes bu yis // 'gro ba yongs la phan gdag phyir // nad rnams thams cad dpyad kyis gso // rkyen rnams thams cad gto yis sel // ltas ngan ye 'brog mthu yis bzlog // gdon rigs brgyad bcu stobs kyis 'dul // bgegs rigs stong phrag glud kyis 'jal // 'dre dgu sri bcu bskyas kyis 'debs //

The man who is clever in methods of subduing any of them wherever they may be, in order to benefit all living beings, cures by diagnosing all illnesses, exorcises by ritual all accidental circumstances, reverses by magical force evil portents and injuries, subdues by force the 80 classes of evil spirits, pays with ransoms the thousands of obstructions, dispatches the nine demons and ten vampires.
de yang 'dre dgu sri bcu ste // gnas pa sa gzhi'i klong du gnas // rgyu ba phyogs 'tshams brgyad du rgyu // bsdong ba ma bla chud dang sdong // gtong ba glo bur ye 'brog gtong //

Now as for these nine demons and ten vampires, for dwelling place, they dwell on the face of the earth. For moving, they move in all eight directions. As associates, they associate with Ma-bla-chud. As for what they send, they send sudden injuries.

mtho ru mi ster dma' ba'i 'dre // yod du mi ster med pa'i 'dre // phyug du mi ster dbul ba'i 'dre // 'phan du mi ster rmang ba'i 'dre // gang du mi ster stong ba'i 'dre // chags su mi ster 'jig pa'i 'dre // yag du mi ster nyes pa'i 'dre // skyid du mi ster sdug gi 'dre // 'phel du mi ster 'grib kyi 'dre // srid pa chags nas srid pa yis // srid pa'i 'dre dgu bya ba ste // de las mas kyi sri ldang ba // pho sri ral chen gri bdud rje // mo sri dar ma gzhon bdud rje // pho mo stang dbyal 'tshos pa la // che sri chung sri dar sri dang // rgan sri gzhon sri dar sri dang // bye sri byur sri la sogs te // 'dre dgu sri bcu dmag dang chas // snang srid 'jig rten khams su 'phyo // rgyal khams mi bde 'khrugs par byed // stong khams mi bde nad yams gtong // [205a] sems can thams cad sdug cing bsngal // 'gro ba mi la bdud du 'bebs // byol song phyugs la gnod cing 'tshe // de dag thabs la brten te gzung // ming dang mtshan ma shes par bya // thabs kyis ngos nas gzung ba'o //

There are demons of depression who do not allow one to rise, demons of wrong who do not allow one to be right, demons of poverty who do not allow one to be rich, demons of feebleness who do not allow one to prosper, demons of emptiness who do not allow repletion, demons of destruction who do not allow production, demons of evil who do not allow good, demons of suffering who do not allow happiness, demons of diminution who do not allow increase. Because they came into existence when the existing world was produced, they are called the nine original (viz. existing) demons. Then there arose the vampires of the lower regions, the father vampire is the Lord Murder-Devil of the Great Mane, the mother vampire the Lady Youth-Devil of Life’s Prime. From these parents, male and female, were produced Great Vampires, Small Vampires, (Medium) Vampires, Old Vampires, Young Vampires, Prime-of-Life Vampires, Divorcing Vampires, Malicious Vampires, and all the rest, together with the Ten Devil Nine Vampire Army. They meander about the regions of the phenomenal world. They cause unhappiness and disputes in all lands. Everywhere they send unhappiness and plagues. All living beings are in suffering. Upon men they descend as devils. Upon animals and cattle they bring harm and torment. Lay hold of them by relying on right methods and know their names and characteristics. This is what is meant by methodical recognition.

thabs kyis rdzong 'debs bskyal ba ni // chab nag srid pa'i bon po yis // lha gzhi'i gong du sbran ma blug // sbran ma'i steng du sgron me bkyag // lha ni gar gsas btsan po bsgom // srid pa'i smrang gis gzu dpang gsol // gar gsas btsan po mngon spyan drangs // gser g.yu rin chen spyan gzigs 'bul // g.yu 'brang bdud rtsi phud kyis mchod //
