Now as for dispatching them methodically, The bonpo of the original ‘Black Waters’ scatters libations on the sacred mat, presents lights over the libations, meditates on the god Gar-gsas-btsan-po, begs him to be mediator, using (the words of) the original exposition, invites Gar-gsas-btsan-po to be present, offers before him gold, turquoise and gems, worships him with an offering of consecrated chang.

de la skad kyi gcong gnyis sbyar // snang zhing srid pa'i 'jig rten na // gnas pa'i skye 'gro ma lus rnams // srid pa gsas kyis bzhen 'debs pa // bya rgyal khyung gi gcong la drangs // 'dre dgu sri bcu bzhen 'debs pa // skad snyan ne tso'i gcong la drangs //

For this one uses two vocal ululations: when the Original gSas (viz. Gar-gsas-btsan-po) exhorts all the living beings who dwell in the existing world, he invites them with the ululation of the royal bird Khyung; when he exhorts the nine demons and ten vampires, he invites them with the well-sounding ululation of the parrot.

gsal dag smrang gis go bar bya // 'dod pa'i glu dang yas stags bsngo // sna tshogs rdzas kyis rdzong la 'debs // 'dod dgu re ba'i skya yas rdzong // glu yas gnas su thing par bsngo // 'dre dgu bskyal ba'i smrang gto bya // sri bcu gnon pa'i sri gto bya // kag nyen bzlog pa'i nyen gto bya // rten 'brel srid pa'i rtsis gto bya // de ltar gto thabs gzhung bzhi las // gang 'dul bye brag so sor dbye // de ni thabs kyis 'dul ba'o //

By means of a clearly given exposition all will be understood. Pleasing songs and ritual items must be consecrated as gifts, and one dispatches them with various offerings and dismisses them with the desirable presents for which they hoped. One must consecrate the songs and the offerings so that they reach the intended object. For removing the nine demons one must do the Exposition Ritual. For suppressing the ten vampires one must do the Vampire Ritual. For rebutting impediments one must do the Ritual against Troubles. For happenings in dependent relationship do the Calculation Ritual. Thus according to the four lores of ritual methods, distinguish differences wherever you do the subduing. This is subduing by Method.
2b
2b
gnyis pa thugs rjes 'dul ba la // thugs rje las kyis 'dul ba dang // thugs rje thabs kyis 'dul ba'o //
Secondly as for subduing by means of Compassion, there is a way of subduing by means of compassionate karmic effects, and a way of subduing by means of compassionate methods.

thugs rje las kyis 'dul ba la // sngon nas las kyi 'phro can gyis // [205b] sbyangs pa sngon song nus pa yis // da lta skyes lus mngon byung la // ting nge 'dzin gyi 'od zer dang // las kyi 'phro mthun nus pa yi // sngon sbyangs shugs kyis 'dul ba'o //

As for subduing by means of compassionate karmic effects, one who has a continuance of karmic effects from previous births, by capabilities practised in former times, in the body which he now really has, subdues with a force derived from former practice, (a force) of which the effectiveness corresponds with the continuance of karmic effects and with the rays of his profound meditation.

thugs rje thabs kyis 'dul ba la // 'di ru thabs la' brten nas su // bsnyen dang sgrub pa'i sgo ru 'jug // thabs kyi lag len ldan pa yis // thabs kyi man ngag bslab par bya // thabs kyi man ngag ldan pa yis // thabs kyi rgyun la 'jug par bya // thabs kyi rgyun la 'jug pa yis // thabs kyi drod tshad ldan par bya // yi dam lha yi mngon rtogs bsgom // snang zhing srid pa bskos la 'debs // lha srin sde brgyad bzhen 'debs bya // 'dre dgu sri bcu thur du gnon // gar gsas dbal gyi sku ru bskyed // gdug pa 'dul mdzad drag po'i dbal // dgu khri dgu 'bum dbal gyi tshogs // bye ba sa ya gtso dang 'khor //

As for subduing by means of compassionate methods, in this case relying upon method, one begins by way of invocation and conjuration. One who has the techniques of method must learn the art of method. One who has the art of method must embark upon the process of method. He who has embarked upon the process of method must acquire the ‘advance-grades’ of method. He must meditate upon the delineation of the tutelary divinity. He must bring (mentally) the phenomenal world into order. He must set the eight kinds of sprites, demons and the rest, to their tasks. He must suppress the nine demons and ten vampires. He must invoke Gar-gsas-dbal in bodily form, the mighty dBal who subjugates evil, the host of dBal 99,000 strong, the chief and his entourage, a million times ten million strong.
ma rig log par gol ba yi // nga rgyal dreg pa'i ri bo gzhom // zhi nas snang srid dga' bde bskyed // stong gsum 'khrugs pa gto yis bcos //

He must overcome the mountain of arrogance and pride, ignorantly and falsely erring. Having brought tranquillity, he must bring joy and happiness to phenomenal life, and by means of the ritual he must cure the world’s disturbances.
'khros nas khams gsum dbang du bsdu // snang zhing srid pa dbang la 'debs // gar gsas btsan po dbang gi lha //
In his wrath he shall bring all the world in his power. He shall subdue to his power all phenomenal existence, this Gar-gsas-btsan-po, god of power.
thabs dang thugs rje zung 'brel gyis // e ma ngo mtshar che ba'i bon //
Since it unites as a pair Method and Compassion, O how wonderful is the great Bon!
snang gshen gtsug phu thugs la zhog // sems bskyed gzhi ma ldan par gyis // sems can 'gro la sman par mdzod // ces gsungs so /
sNang-gshen gTsud-phud, keep this in mind. Having raised your Thought (towards Enlightenment) have this as your basis of action, and bring benefit to living beings. This is what he said.
de nas yang rgyal bus bka' stsal pa / nyon cig snang gshen gtsug phud dang / 'dus pa'i 'khor rnams thams cad kun // ma yengs dbang po brtan par nyon //
Then again the Prince said: Listen, sNang-gshen gTsug-phud and all your entourage which is gathered here. Listen attentively with senses alert.
chab nag gyer gyi sgo bzhi la // gsum pa 'phan yul glud gyi sgo //
(3) Of the four portals of incantation of the ‘Black Waters’ the third is 'Phan-yul, the portal of ransom.

'gro [206a] drug sems can thams cad dang // snang zhing srid pa thams cad la // phan dang gnod par byed nas su // glud dang yas su snyeg pa la // chab nag srid pa'i bon po yis // sems can 'gro la phan gdag phyir // mnyam gnyis brje la glud re bzang // mnyam gnyis brje ba'i mtshungs gto bya //

Doing both good and harm to all the beings of the Six Spheres and to the whole of phenomenal existence, (gods and demons) hasten for ransoms and ritual offerings. So the bonpo of the original ‘Black Waters’, in order to benefit living beings, exchanges two equal things and so (gives) a good ransom, performing the Rite of Equivalence, the exchange of two equal things.
de la rnam pa gsum yin te // pho glud mo glud chung glud gsum //
This rite is of three kinds, male ransom, female ransom and child ransom.

pho glud dag la rnam pa bcu // dbus nas lha min 'khrugs mdos dang // steng nas tshangs pa'i lha mdos dang // shar nas rgyal po'i skyong mdos dang // byang nas btsan gyi skong mdos dang // nub nas bdud kyi khram mdos dang // lho nas gshin rje'i zlog mdos dang //

lho shar dmu yi gcun mdos dang // byang shar btsan gyi dal mdos dang // byang nub klu dbang gtad mdos dang // lho nub srin po'i mkhar mdos bcu // pho glud dag tu shes par bya // mo glud dag la rnam pa bcu //

chud kyi rgyal mo'i g.yang mdos dang // steng phyogs ma mo'i skong mdos dang // ma yam rgyal mo'i zlog mdos dang // snang srid ma mo'i 'khrugs mdos dang // brtan ma dmag gi khram mdos dang // skyong ma khram gyi gzi mdos dang // kha la gangs dkar sman mdos dang // sman mo gzed kyi tshang mdos dang // ma bdud rgyal mo'i brtan mdos dang // ma yam btsun mo'i gnad mdos bcu // mo glud dag tu shes par bya //

The female ransom is of ten kinds: the ‘blessing’ quittance of the queen of the Chud, the ‘atoning’ quittance of the mother-goddesses of the upper regions, the ‘averting’ quittance of the queen Ma-yam, the ‘confusion’ quittance of the mother-goddesses of phenomenal existence, the ‘tally-stick’ quittance of the army of brTan-ma. the ‘banded agate’ quittance of sKyong-ma-khram, the ‘medicament’ quittance of Kha-la-gangs-dkar, the ‘complete’ quittance of sMan-mo-gzed, the ‘firm’ quittance of queen Ma-bdud, the ‘vital’ quittance of lady Ma-yam. These ten are to be known as the female ransoms.

chung glud dag la rnam pa bcu // 'dre dgu sri bcu tshang mdos dang // tshe bdud nag po'i zlog mdos dang // skyes bu brgyad kyi dpung mdos dang // dbang ldan bgegs kyi glud mdos dang // sa bdag gtod kyi spur mdos dang // gtsang sme 'dres pa'i skyom [206b] mdos dang // mtshungs gnyis gsor ba'i skyon mdos dang // mnyam gnyis brje ba'i glud mdos dang // rtsa dkar 'phel ba'i gag mdos bcu // chung glud dag tu shes par bya //

The child ransom is of ten kinds: the ‘complete’ quittance of the nine demons and ten vampires, the ‘averting’ quittance of the black life-demons, the ‘host’ quittance of the eight children, the ‘ransom’ quittance of the powerful obstructors, the ‘corpse’ quittance of the local gods of the soil and the rocks, the ‘shaking’ quittance of mingled purity and impurity, the ‘fault’ quittance of the transposing of two equivalent things, the ‘ransom’ quittance of the exchanging of two equal things, the ‘impediment’ quittance for producing a child. These ten are to be known as the child ransoms.

de rnams dag la gyes pa yi // g.yen sde sum cu rtsa gsum la // rgyan mdos sum cu rtsa gsum yod // de ltar drug cu rtsa gsum las // mdos rigs sum brgya drug cu gyes // pho glud thams cad brjid dang bcas // mo glud thams cad bkrag dang bcas // chung glud thams cad blta na sdug //

So these are clearly separated, but for the thirty-three divisions of non-gods there are thirty-three ‘adornment’ quittances. Then from the total of sixty-three there come 360 kinds of quittance. All the male ransoms have brilliance. All the female ransoms have lustre. All the child ransoms are fair to behold.
spyir ni 'tshogs pa'i yo byad ni // snang gshen glud yas smrang gi brug // rgyal ba 'phags pa'i bden pas bkrol //

Generally considered the ritual necessaries which have been brought together, the sNang-gshen ransoms and ritual items are explained by the flow of the exposition which is the true word of the noble conquerors.

stong gsum stong gi 'jig rten na // tshang rgyung ri bdun rol mtsho bcas // lcags ri khyud mo 'khor mo'i gling // gling bzhir gling phran nyi zla'i 'od // dpag bsam ljon pa zil gnon khyung // mtho ste srid pa'i rtse mo man chad dang // dma' ste na rag yan chad la // ma tshang mi tshang med pas su // glud dang yas su bstan pa ni // stong gsum stong la ci yod pa // mi lus dag la de yod pas // glud kyang de bzhin 'dod pa'o //

In the 1,000 times 3,000 world-complex, the Universe with its seven (surrounding) mountain ranges and seven sprightly oceans, a circular land-mass with a ring of iron-mountains, with four continents, and lesser continents, and light of sun and moon, with the tree of paradise surmounted by the Bird Khyung, from its summit, the highest point of existence, down to its depths in the hells, there is nothing whatsoever incomplete, and all this is shown as ransom and items of ritual. Whatever there is in the 1,000 times 3,000 world-complex, since it exists for human bodies, they want the ransom to be like that.

'byung po mi min dri za'i tshogs // 'gro ba mi la dpyad tsam na // stong gsum tshang rgyung 'jig rten na // 'dod yon sna tshogs ra ba na // pho rnams stang dang mo rnams dbyal // yid du 'ong dang 'dod dgu ldan // de dag gnas dang 'khra sar 'dod // de phyir skye 'gro gzugs su zhugs // de la rol rtsed ltad mo dang // zas skom bcud la rol par snang //

The hosts of spirits, non-human beings and parasites, when they look at human beings, in this world of the 3,000-fold universe, in this enclosure of so various desirable things, they want as their abode and their dwelling place the males the husbands, the females the wives, with their pleasing and desirable things. So they enter the bodies of living beings. They play there delightedly and seem to take pleasure in what they see and in the goodness of food and drink.

'gro ba ma rig rtog tshogs sbyong // rig pa'i ye shes mthong med cing // ma rig mun pa'i smag gnas kyang // de la tshor myong dran par [207a] 'gyus // mi bde sdug bsngal byung tshor bas // ma rig pa la nad du bslang // ma rtogs gol ba'i rkyen du bslad // de las gzung 'dzin nyon mongs skyes // rang gi ma rig pa las byung // gzhan gyi ma rtogs pa la rkyen //

In their ignorance living beings are inured to a host of doubts. Lacking the insight of understanding knowledge, they remain in the dark blackness of ignorance. But they feel it and they dart here and there in their thoughts. They feel that unhappiness and suffering have come, and to them in their ignorance it is turned into sickness. It is corrupted into an occasion of erring incomprehension and from this there arise the afflictions which affect self and others. This happens because of their own ignorance and its occasion is the incomprehension of others.

don du rang gzhan gnyis ka'i lan // tshor myong der 'dzin 'du ba 'khrugs // yul la ma rmongs gces 'dzin dran // sems la byung tshor 'jigs skrag byed // ri dwags rgya ru chud pa 'dra // ma go ma rig ma rtogs pas // mo gto dpyad kyis phan par 'dod //

In effect both self and others are to blame. They cling to what they feel and the balance of the humours is disturbed. They think of worldly things with unimpaired attachment. They feel something has happened to their mind and they are frightened. They are like a deer which has run into a trap. Lacking understanding, comprehension and knowledge, they want to be helped by sortilege, ritual and diagnosis.

smre zhing sdug bsngal mchi ma 'byung // sdug bsngal nyon mongs sbyong ba las // de la rgyal ba'i thugs rje yis // nad la dpyad dang bgegs la gto // gang la gang dgos rim pa yi // gang 'dul der ston thabs mchog bstan // ma rig pa la rig pa bstan // ma rtogs pa la go bas bkrol // brda dang thabs kyis don bstan pa // sems can nyon mongs rang sar zhi //

They lament and shed tears in their suffering. For them the Conqueror’s compassion, removing evils and afflictions, (gives) diagnosis for illness and ritual against demons. Whatever is required by anyone, all in good order, for whatever is to be subdued the Teacher has taught an excellent method. He has taught knowledge to the ignorant. To the incomprehending he has explained things through the understanding. By signs and methods he demonstrates the matter and the afflictions of living beings are properly calmed.

kun rdzob mtshan bcas dngos por bden // g.yung drung bon la yid kha brod // gshen po'i tshig la gnyan par brtsi // dkar po'i dge la spro ba bskyed // bstan pa'i bon la mos pa yi // dad pa gong du 'phel ba dang // gshen po'i smrang la gnyan pa yis // phyis kyang bka' gnyan btsan par 'gyur // de'i phyir lha la yon phul cing // nag po bdud la glud gtong ba // 'jug sgo thabs kyi yan lag yin // lar yang 'gro ba 'dul ba la // thabs dang thugs rje zung 'brel nas // yun du mi thog 'phral la 'grub // rgyu 'bras theg pa'i rim pa yang // rgyu yi [207b] theg pa thabs yin zhing // 'bras bu'i theg pa thugs rje'o //

The characteristics of relative truth are true in relation to things, (and if you help people with these things) their minds will take pleasure in Swastika Bon. They will take solemn account of the word of the priest. They will delight in virtuous deeds, and with devotion to doctrinal bon their faith will be on the increase. By listening to the exposition of the priest, the coercion will be potent afterwards. Therefore making offerings to the gods and giving ransoms to black demons are methodical ways for entering (the doctrine). Moreover in converting living beings, one unites Method and Compassion, so it does not take long—the work is effected in no time. The whole order of the Ways of Cause and Effect relates method to the (four) Ways of Cause and compassion to the (five) Ways of Effect.
de gnyis zung du 'brel ba na // bla na med pa'i theg pa ste // rgyu 'bras gnyis su med pa'i don // ma brtsal lhun gyis grub pa'o //
These two united are the highest of all ways, for that which does not distinguish cause and effect is effortlessly and spontaneously produced.

de'i phyir bgegs kyi bar chod las // bgegs la glud phan gto ru bya // gto la rnam grangs mang yod kyang // 'di ni mnyam gnyis brje ba dang // mtshungs gnyis gsor ba'i skyin gto ste // srid pa rgyud kyi bon po yis // sems can 'gro la phan 'dogs na // chab nag rgyud las byung ba ltar // mdos kyang glud kyi yo byad bsag //

So when obstructing demons give trouble, perform the ritual which benefits by giving ransom to these demons. Although there are long lists of rituals, this (we are concerned with) is the ‘pledge ritual’, the exchanging of two equal things, the transposing of two equivalent things. The bonpo of the original tradition, when he thus benefits living beings, must assemble the quittance and items of ransom, as manifested in the tradition of the ‘Black Waters’.

rang bas gzhan don gtso che zhing // rang la 'dod pa'i lhad med par // rgyu 'bras mi brtsi thob rdzob spang // snang gshen 'bras bu drang srong bsnyag // de'i phyir spyod lam dal bar bya // mi 'gro'i yas sogs spang bar bya // mkho mthun rdzas cha bsgrub par bya //

Making others’ interests more important than his own, without the impurity of selfish motives, he must avoid the false ambition which takes no account of the fact that effects must follow from causes. The Way of the Shen of the Phenomenal World seeks after as effect the Way of the Great Ascetics, so perform your practice carefully. Avoid unsuitable items, and prepare things as fitting.

mdos la rnam pa gsum yin ste // phyi mdos nang mdos gsang mdos gsum // phyi mdos sog khrig lag len rdzas // nang mdos glud yas gyer dang smrang // gsang mdos ting 'dzin dgongs pa'i rdzas // gsum ka zung 'brel 'gro ba skyob // dang por phyi mdos sog khrig lag len la // rgyas 'bring bsdus gsum skabs dang sbyar // rgyas pa dag la khri 'gyur 'bum // 'bring po dag la stong 'gyur bcu // tha ma dag la brgya 'gyur bcu // yang mtha' dag la bcu 'gyur bcu //

The quittance is of three kinds, the external quittance, the internal quittance and the secret quittance. The outer quittance consists of the set of implements, the technical items. The internal quittance consists of the item of ransom, the incantation and the exposition. The secret quittance consists of meditation and the things of thought. Uniting all three, one protects living beings. First, as for the outer quittance, the technical matter of the set of implements, in accordance with the occasion (these are done) in extended manner, in medium manner and in a compressed manner. For the extended manner 10,000 times 100,000 (sets are prepared), for the medium manner 10 times 1,000, for the inferior manner 10 times 100, and for a very inferior manner 10 times 10.
de yang so so'i dbang ris la // stong gsum sgron me khri 'gyur 'bum // 'khor lo bsgyur rgyal stong 'gyur khri // de 'og gshen po brgya 'gyur stong // rgyal phran dag la lnga brgya'o //
btsun [208a] mo sum brgya drug cu ste // blon po ded dpon brgya bcu drug // btsun pa brgya dang rtsa brgyad de // khyim pha drug cu rtsa gcig go //

gzhi 'dzin btsun mo lnga bcu gcig // khye'u bu mo nyi shu lnga // bran dang pho nya bcu gsum la // dman pa dag la lnga re sogs // ji bzhin rim pa mtho ba bzhin // rkyen kyang de bzhin gnyan por slong // ji bzhin 'khor lo bsgyur ba bzhin // bdud kyang de bzhin zhing khams g.yo // de'i phyir gong 'phel sog dang sbyor //

mdos gzhi tshang rgyung 'jig rten nas // dpe blang de bzhin skye 'gro'i gzugs // ji ltar tshogs bzhin de bzhin shes // srid pa'i rtse mo man chad nas // na rag gdar so yan chad la // srid pa 'greng dang 'phred nyal sbub // gnam la 'phur dang sa la 'dzul // bar na 'grim dgu'i gzugs brnyan bya // pho mo skye mched spu mtshan gzugs // mi bas glud bzang lhems se lhem // bya bas 'dab bzang spu ru ru // sgam bas mchid smra sha ra ra // rgyal bas brjid 'gying lam se lam // blon bas che btsun 'jol lo lo // rta rgyug mda' 'phen gzhu brdung cog // glu len bal bkal phyar ra phyor // rtsed 'jo gar stabs ldem ma ldem //

For the substance of your quittance take as model the Universe, and the shapes of living beings, as many as are gathered there, you must pay regard to them too. From the peak of existence down to the very bottom of hell, beings that go upright, athwart and bowed down, those that fly in the sky and creep in the earth, those that wander through space, make effigies of all. Give males and females their sense-organs, their hair and characteristic marks. The ransom must be better than a human being. Feathers must be better than those of real birds. The words must be better than those of the (proverbial) bat. The glory must be greater than that of a king. The nobility must exceed that of a minister. Racing horses, firing arrows, drawing bows, singing songs, spinning wool, all so busy playing games and dancing, all so gay.

snang gshen phan gnod gnyis su blta // sems can yongs la phan sems bsgom // gar gsas btsan po lha ru bdar // gshen rab bden pa'i smrang gis bkrol // gto yas gnas su thing bar bya // snang srid lha 'dre skong gis bskang // tshe skyin srog glud dam pa dang // gsang mdos ngar mi rgyan ldan dang // 'bul ba rang gis mi [208b] nor la // bzhes pa gdon gyis mi nor bar // ting 'dzin smrang gis brda sprad bya // de la skad kyi gcong gnyis sbyar // glud gsas lha yi bzhen 'debs la // seng ge nga ro'i gcong la drang // lha srin bskod la bzhen 'debs pa // lcog ga'i 'gyur skad gcong la drang // de ltar 'phan yul glud kyi sgo // sems can 'gro la sman par 'gyur // snang gshen gtsug phud thugs la zhog // 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal zhi bar mdzod // ces gsungs so /

According to the Way of the Shen of the Phenomenal World, one must see benefit and harm as two distinct things. One must concentrate the mind on benefiting all beings. One must invoke Gar-gsas-btsan-po as presiding divinity. One must give explanation with the exposition which is the true word of the Best of Shen. By means of the ritual one must strike the mark. By ceremony of atonement one must satisfy the gods and demons of the phenomenal world. With regard to the sacred ransom and pledge of life, and the secret quittance with its outer adornment of figurines, the offerer himself must make no mistake. So that the demons who receive the items do not make mistakes, the intention of the profound meditation must be explained by means of the exposition. Two kinds of ululation are used for the words. For coercing the presiding divinity of the ransom, draw him with the ululation of a roaring lion. For coercing gods and monsters to their appointed tasks, draw them with the ululation of a lark’s warbling note. Thus the 'Phan-yul way of ransoms will bring benefit to living beings. sNang-gshen gTsug-phud, keep this in mind. Quieten the sufferings of living beings. This is what he said.
de nas yang rgyal bus bka' stsal pa / nyon cig snang gshen gtsug phud nyon //
Then again the Prince spoke: (4) Listen, sNang-gshen gTsug-phud, listen.

rang che gyong khengs nga rgyal spyad // ma sangs gnyan la kha che zhing // sa bdag gtod la lag ring nas // dbyings na bzhugs pa'i lha mi mchod // mkha' la gnas pa'i dbal mi bskang // klong na dam can tshogs mi bsten // de'i phyir ma sangs gnyan dang 'gras // sa bdag gtod kyi tshogs dang mkhon // dbyings na bzhugs pa'i lha mi mnyes // mkha' la gnas pa'i dbal mi bskang // klong du dam can tshogs kyis bkyon // de bzhin sa bdag klu gnyan dang // bdud btsan ma mo gshin rje dang // brtan ma skyong ma'i tshogs dang 'gal // lha srung dam can rnams dang 'gal // de yi bka' chad nyes skyon gyis // 'gro ba mi la bdud du bab // tshe srog dbang po dpal kha nyams // klung rta dbang thang bsod nams rgud // 'gro ba mi bde sdug bsngal sbyong // de la rgyal ba'i thugs rje yis // thabs dang thugs rje ma 'gag phyir // 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal sel ba la // dpon gsas phyag gnyen gto yi sgo //

Acting with self-esteem, arrogance and pride, to be overweening with the Ma-sangs Furies, to be mean with the lords of the soil and the rocks, failing to worship the gods who dwell in the celestial sphere, failing to satisfy the dBal who live in the sky, not trusting in the host of our divine guarantors throughout space, results in the ill-will of the Ma-sangs Furies, in the animosity of the lords of the soil and the rocks, in the displeasure of the gods who dwell in the celestial spheres, in the dissatisfaction of the dBal who live in the sky, in the spite of our divine guarantors throughout space. In this way the lords of the soil, the serpents and furies, the demons, the fiends, the mother-goddesses, the spirits of death, the brTan-ma and the hosts of protectors will oppose us, the protecting gods and divine guarantors will oppose us. Punishment from them which is evil and harm brings demonish assaults upon human beings. The lustre of life and of sense-powers will be weakened, Well-being, influence and merit will decline. One eliminates the unhappiness and suffering of beings, for due to the compassion of the Conqueror, So that Method and Compassion may not be limited and for removing the sufferings of living beings (we have) this portal of ritual, the ‘office’ of the Master-Sages.
'di la rnam pa bzhi yin te // dbyings kyi lha tshogs tshogs kyis mchod // mkha' yi dbal mo skong gis bskang // [209a] klong gi dam can rten gyis brten // sa bdag klu gnyan gto yis bcos //

It is of four kinds: worshipping with general offerings the hosts of gods in the heavens, satisfying with atonement the dBal-mo of the skies, trusting with trust the divine guardians of space, remedying with ritual the lords of the soil, the serpents and the furies.

thog mar lha tshogs mchod pa la // srid pa rgyud kyi bon po yis // tshogs chen mchod pa'i yo byad gdeg // [stobs chen gar gyi dbal tshogs la //] gzhi ma gtsang ma'i steng du ni // 'bru yi tshom bu dgod par bya // de steng dbal gyi bshos bu la // sha khrag dkar mngar 'dod yon tshogs //

First, for worshipping the hosts of gods, the bonpo of the original tradition should set up the items for worshipping with the great mass of offerings. On a clean place (which serves as) the basis he should place heaps of grain, and then the point-shaped sacrificial cake, flesh and blood, the milk-offering, sweet-offerings and the general offerings of all desirable things,

yu ti zhal zas longs spyod tshogs // du sam mang thun bang nge bshos // gzugs sgra dri ro reg bya'i tshogs // 'dod yon mchod pa dpag med bsham // ting 'dzin dgongs pas dag par spel // stong gsum gtos dang nam mkha'i rgya // 'dod yon zad med rgya mtsho'i klong // snang srid rin chen gter gyis bkang // dmigs med mchod pa nam mkha'i sprin // lha gsas dbal la mchod pa 'bul // thugs dam rgyud mnyes chag nyams bskang // gar gsas dbal gyi dngos grub zhu // des ni 'gro ba'i bar chod sel //

change, food-offerings, and the general offerings of all enjoyable things, drink-offerings, sweetened sacrificial cakes, meat, ordinary sacrificial cakes, offerings (symbolizing) form, sound, smell, taste and touch, innumerable items of worship are set up in the form of all desirable things. By concentration of meditation he increases the offering in all purity. The vastness of the Universe, the expanse of the sky, the space of the ocean, is filled with an infinite number of desirable things, with all the treasures of phenomenal existence. These unconfined offerings like clouds in the sky are offered in worship to the gods, gSas and dBal All this delights them in accordance with their thoughtful purpose, and atones for all wrong-doings. It calls down the special powers of Gar-gsas-dbal, and he removes the difficulties of living beings.

gnyis pa dbal mo'i (ma) tshogs la // snang zhin srid pa mkha' la bskang // bskang ba'i gnas der bskang bas bkyag // srid pa'i dpe blangs ri rab gling // lcags ri khyud mo ri bdun mtsho // dpag bsam ljon pa zil gnon khyung // rnam rgyal khang pa blta na sdug // shing rta rtsub 'gyur dga' ba 'dres // ud 'bar me tog skyed mo'i tshal // mtshal ri lha 'dun ar mo'i rdo // nyi ma zla ba gsal ba'i sgron // bkra shis rdzas brgyad phun sum tshogs // rin chen nor bdun gram khrod gter // lhab lhub lda ldi chun 'phyang 'phrul // ye shes gzhal yas nam kha'i rgya // shing ris rgyan rdzas longs spyod dkor // rgyang 'phan bal tshon bla re gur // mda' [209b] bkra 'phang bkra thabs shes rtags // 'dab chags ri dwags g.yung dwags dkor // ris bkra (gcan gzan) spu sdug mdzes // mi nor yul mkhar 'dod yon rdzas // pho tong mo tong lan chags glud // rta rgyug mda' 'phen rtsed 'jo stabs // mkho mthun yo byad phun sum tshogs //

Secondly for the feminine host of the dBal-mo one must make an atonement offering (to them) in the sky of the whole of phenomenal existence. In that place of atonement one must offer up as atonement the land-mass of the Best of Mountains taken as a model of existence, with the tree of paradise surmounted by the Bird Khyung, the encircling iron mountains and the seven circles of mountains and seas, the ‘Palace of Victory’ so fair to behold, with the Park for Riding, the Park of Fierceness, the Park of Pleasure and the Park of Intermingling, the Park of Blue Lotuses, the Park of the Red Mountains where the gods assemble, and the Park of Fine Stone (pavements), with sun and moon (to serve as) bright lights, with the eight auspicious symbols, all excellently done, and the treasure of sparkling heaps of the seven kinds of gems. (Adornments hang) in folds and pleats and interwoven loops. The Palace of Wisdom (made from) nets of crossed threads, ritual stakes, decorations and a wealth of pleasing things, the tree-symbol made of coloured wools and the canopy, the fine arrow and distaff, symbols of Method and Wisdom. a wealth of feathered fowl, wild animals and domestic animals, fierce beasts of wonderful form with coats of fine hues, the substance of men’s wealth, their houses and the things they value, male effigies, female effigies, ransoms for debts of evil, horses running, men shooting arrows, others in the act of play, the necessary items, all excellently done.

rang mthun gtor ma rgyan dang ldan // gser g.yu dar stag lhab lhub rgyan // g.yu 'bran bdud rtsi skyems pa'i phud // rnga gshang dung gling snyan pa'i sgra // bden pa'i smrang dang smra ba'i tshig // go ba'i brda sbyar srid pa'i gzhung // sngon gyi dpe srol cho rabs bshad // srid pa'i lugs nas 'byung bzhin du // dbal mo ma tshogs mkha' la bskang // dam can rgya mtsho klong mnyes // srid pa gsum po zil gyis gnon // snang zhin srid pa'i kha yo snyoms // 'gro ba sdug bsngal nyon mongs zhi // des ni bar chod rkyen rnams bzlog // snang srid zhi bde cha la snyoms // de'i phyir dbal mo skong gis bcos // mkha' klong rab 'byams dbyings su bskang // chab dkar sngags kyi gzhun la 'gres //

Sacrificial cakes suitable for each (divinity) and well-adorned, gold, turquoise, silk, tiger-skin, decorations hanging in folds, offerings of consecrated chang as libations, drums, flat bells, conch-shells, shawms, all well-sounding, the exposition of truth, words that produce understanding, the original lore which is the explanation of (the priest) who understands. He explains the earliest archetype and the lineage As it appears according to the original pattern, one must make atonement to the feminine host of the dBal-mo in the sky. The ocean-like host of divine guarantors will be gratified. The three spheres of beings will be subjected. The crookedness of phenomenal existence will be smoothed flat. The sufferings and afflictions of living beings will be assuaged. By such means opposing circumstances will be reversed. Phenomenal existence will be smoothed into a state of peace and happiness. So attend to the dBal-mo with the ceremony of atonement, performing it through the celestial spheres of the vast space of the sky. This is continued in the Lore of Spells of the White Waters.

gsum pa klong gi dam can la // rang mthun rten gyi dam rdzas bsham // 'dod yon longs spyod mngon cha 'bul // sha khrag dkar mngar g.yu 'brang phud // 'ban tshogs lha yi gtor mas mchod // thugs dam gnad bskul 'phrin las bcol // dgyes mdzad dam pa'i dngos grub zhu // 'gro ba'i tshe dpal dmu thag skyob // dam can srung ma ngang gis 'du // gar gsas dbal gyi pho nya la // dmigs pa'i rten 'dzug 'phrin las bcol //

Thirdly for the divine guarantors in space prepare the sacred items serving as symbols fitting to each one. Offer the gifts of desirable and pleasing things, flesh and blood, the milk-offerings, the sweet offerings, and the libations of chang, and worship them with the general offerings and the sacred cakes of the gods. Urge their purposes to essential things and set them to work. Cause them to rejoice, and request the sacred special powers. They will defend the life-lustre and the ‘heavenly cord’ of living beings. The guarantor-defenders will gather around of their own accord. Set up the symbols intended for the functionaries of Gar-gsas-dbal and set them to work.

bzhi pa sa bdag klu gnyan la // snang srid gto yis bcos pa [210a] la // stong gsum 'khrugs pa'i yo bcos dang // 'byung ba 'khrugs pa'i 'gram bcos dang // ye ngam 'khrugs pa'i bsdum bcos dang // sa bdag sme ba'i gling bcos dang // klu gnyan gtod kyi 'gram bcos dang // snang srid kha bskang zhi bcos dang // rnam pa bdun du shes par bya //

Fourthly for the lords of the soil, the serpents and the furies, for remedying phenomenal existence by means of ritual, it should be known that there are seven types: ‘remedy for crookedness of the Universe in disorder’, ‘remedy for harm of the great elements in disorder’, ‘reconciling remedy for gods and demons in disorder’, ‘remedy of the sMe-ba region for lords of the soil’, ‘remedy for harm of serpents, furies and lords of the rocks’, ‘tranquillizing remedy of atoning for phenomenal existence’.

'gro ba sems can don ched du // srid pa rgyud kyi bon po yis // gtsang ma'i sa la ma 'dal bya // sa tshon sna lngas gzhal yas bris // sa bdag klu gnyan gtod kyi tshogs // spar kha lo skor sme ba gling // gzhi gnas mnga' dbang 'khor dang bcas //

For the sake of living beings the bonpo of the original tradition must make the mystic circle on a clean place. He draws the divine palace with the five different colours. (This is for) the lords of the soil, the furies and lords of the rocks in their hosts, the circle of sPar-kha and the region of sMe-ba, the local divinities with their powerful entourage.

'bru sna'i gzugs dang bshos gtsang dang // 'dab chags ri dbags g.yung dwags dang // gcan gzan mi nor yul mkhar dang // skye 'gro'i gzugs dang chu gnas dang // sna tshogs spu mtshan tshang ba dang // shing rtsi bal bu bya spu mtshon // gser g.yu dar zab sna tshogs brgyan // 'dod yon mchod pa dpag med bsham // ting 'dzin dgongs pa'i sngags kyis spel // gar gsas btsan po lha ru bdar // rnga gshang dung gling skad kyis 'bod // ba dan ru mtshon brda yis g.yab // gser skyems g.yu mngon brngan cha 'bul // rgyal ba bden pa'i smrang gis bkrol // de la skad kyi gcong gnyis sbyar // dpon gsas phyag gnyen bskos 'debs shing // snang zhin srid pa kha gnon pa // sgra rgyal 'brug gi gcong la drang // gto yas glud kyi ngo bsngo zhing // phyag gnyen gnas su bstim pa ni // gsung snyan khu byug gcong la drang //

Effigies (made from) the different kinds of grain and pure sacrificial cakes, feathered fowl, wild animals and domestic animals, fierce beasts, the subtance of men’s wealth, their houses, the forms of living beings and those who live in water, with fur and marks of different kinds, all (shown) complete, aromatic shrubs, woollen strands stuck with birds’ feathers, all adorned with gold and turquoise and different kinds of silks. Thus one must prepare limitless worship of desirable things. One increases it by means of the spells of concentrated meditation. One invokes Gar-gsas-btsan-po as presiding divinity. One calls him with drums, flat bells, conches and shawms. One waves as signals flags and pennants. One offers gifts and a libation of consecrated chang. One explains by means of the exposition which is the truth of the Conqueror. For the voice one uses two ululations. For ordering the ‘office’ of the Master-Sages and for subduing phenomenal existence one uses the ululation of the dragon, the king of sound. For consecrating the ransoms, the items of ritual, and for directing the ‘office’ to its objective, one uses the ululation of the sweet-sounding cuckoo.

snang zhing srid pa thams cad la // glud yas gtor ma gnas su thing // stong khams re ba bskang bar bya // snang srid zhi bde zhi bar bya // [210b] sa bdag klu gnyan bsdum par bya // thams cad 'khrugs pa zhi ba dang // snang srid dga' bde bskyed par bya // de nas 'gro la phan bde bsod // snang zhing srid pa cha la 'bebs // zhing khams dge ba'i gzhi mar 'gyur //

In the whole of phenomenal existence the sacrificial cakes (which serve as) items of ransom attain their objective. The thousand regions will have their hopes fulfilled. Phenomenal existence will be tranquillized in peace and happiness. The lords of the soil, the serpents and the furies will be reconciled. All disturbances will be tranquillized and joy and happiness will be produced throughout phenomenal existence. Thus living beings will enjoy benefits and happiness. Phenomenal existence is put into order, and these regions become a foundation for virtue.
snang gshen gtsug phud sprul pa'i gshen // spyir yang snang gshen theg pa'i bon // 'gro la phan bde bsod pa'i cha // snang srid dge ba 'phel ba'i thabs // sems bskyed bzhi ma ldan par gces //

sNang-gshen gTsug-phud, Shen who manifest yourself as you will! In general the bon of the Shen Way of the Visual World is something for delighting living beings with benefits and happiness. It is a method for increasing the good of phenomenal existence. But it is important to have as basis the raising of one’s Thought (to Enlightenment).

sems bskyed gzhi ma mi ldan zhing // log par gol ba'i tshogs rnams kyang // bka' lung tshul bzhin spyad byas pas // mthar ni don dang yon tan yang // khams gsum sa dgu yar brgal nas // snang gshen grub ste mos par spyod //

Although they may not have as basis this raising of Thought, even these hosts of mistaken (beings), by acting in accordance with these teachings, in the end (gain) objective and qualities, and having traversed the threefold world and nine stages, they perfect the Shen Way of the Visual World and practise it. with devotion.

g.yung drung sa bcu rim par bgrod // g.yung drung sa bcu rim bgrod nas // bcu gcig kun snang 'od la gnas // de ru mngon par sangs rgyas thob // rgyu yi theg pas 'bras bur bsnyag // theg rim yar bgrod ltung ba med // don la mi gol rtsis mi 'phyug // bon sgo rim pas spyod tshul lo //

Then they traverse in due order the ten Swastika stages, Having traversed in due order the ten Swastika stages they abide in the eleventh stage of ‘Universal Shining Light’. There they gain perfect buddhahood. The Vehicles of Cause follow on to those of Effect. As one traverses upwards through the vehicles, there is no falling back. There is no mistaking the objective and no error in calculation. This is the way of practising in due order the Portals of Bon.

snang gshen gtsug phud sprul pa'i gshen // snang gshen bon gyi gyer sgo bzhi // gcong brgyad skad kyis gtang rag sbyar // snang gshen theg pa rgyu yi bon // snang gshen gtsug phud thugs la zhog // sems can 'gro la sman par mdzod // sems bskyed gzhi ma ldan par mdzod // ma rig dom chol spang bar mdzod // bka' lung tshul bzhing spyod par mdzod // khri smon rgyal bzhad bdag tu bsko // snang gshen bon gyi 'khor lo bskor // bdag gi bstan pa'i gnyer zung zhig //

sNang-gshen gTsug-phud, Shen who manifest yourself at will! These are the Four Portals of Incantation of the Bon of the Shen of the Visual World, and the ceremonies accord with the sounds of eight ululations. This traditional bon of the Way of the Shen of the Visual World, sNang-gshen gTsug-phud, keep it in mind! Bring benefit to living beings. Act with the raising of Thought (towards Enlightenment) as your basis. Avoid ignorant gossiping. Practise in accordance with the teachings. Take charge of the Khri-smon-rgyal-bzhad Palace. Turn the wheel of the bon of the Shen of the Visual World, and watch over the doctrine I have taught.
zhes bka' stsal nas / theg pa gnyis pa snang [211a] gshen gyi bon rnams gtan la phab ste gsungs pa'o //
This is what he said, thus setting forth the teachings of the Second Way of the Shen of the Visual World.
III. 'PHRUL GSHEN THEG PA
III. THE WAY OF THE SHEN OF ILLUSION
[vol. kha, f. 221b4 onwards]

de nas rgyal bus bka' stsal pa / nyon cig 'phrul gshen gtsug phud nyon // da lta'i dus dang gnas skabs 'di dag tu // theg pa gsum pa 'phrul gshen 'chad par byed // 'phrul ni snang zhing srid pa 'phrul bas 'phrul // gshen ni de dag 'dul bar byon pas gshen // ma rig sems can rkyen gyis gol ba rnams // bar chod bgegs kyi rkyen las thar ba dang // 'jig rten dregs pa dbang du bsdu ba dang // dgra bgegs log lta tshar thag gcad pa dang // bstan pa bshig pa gnas su bgral ba'i phyir // dben pa'i gnas gzung brten pa'i rdzas kyang bsag // rdzu 'phrul lha bsgom drag po'i sngags kyang bzla' // phyi nang mtshams gcad yeng med bsnyen dang bsgrub // brnag pa'i las rnams mtha' ru dbyung bar bya // 'gro ba'i rkyen bsal mi mthun bar chod bzlog // bstan pa'i so gzugs log lta cham la dbab // bstan pa'i cha dang ('gro ba) spyi'i phyir du // yid la brnag pa'i zhe sdang [222a] mi dgos dang // gsad gcad dbab dang bsgral ba'i las byas kyang // don la mi gol 'jug sgo'i yan lag yin // 'gro ba'i zhing khams de yis bde bar 'gyur // 'phrul gshen gtsug phud thugs kyi dkyil du zhog // ces bka' stsal to /

Then the Prince said: Listen, 'Phrul-gshen gtsng-phud, listen. At this present time and on this present occasion I will explain the third vehicle, the Shen of Illusion. It is called ‘Illusion’ because the phenomenal world is illusive with illusions. It is called ‘Shen’, because the Shen come to overcome the illusions. For rescuing ignorant beings in erring circumstances from such impeding and obstructing circumstances, for reducing to subjection the proud ones of this world, for finally destroying the false view of foes and impeders, for removing wreckers of the doctrine to their proper place, you should betake yourself to a quiet place and gather there the things on which the rite depends. Meditate on the Gods of Illusion. Mutter powerful spells. Fix the boundary of the profane (outside) and the sacred (inside), and undistractedly practise invocation and conjuration. Evil effects must be expelled. The circumstances of living beings must be purified and opposing obstructions overcome. Establish the doctrine and suppress false views. For the sake of religion and for living beings in general one does not want the sort of wrath which perverts the mind, and although one uses the rites of slaughter and of ‘enforced release’, they do not conflict with the true intention, for they are an entranceway. By such means the realm of living beings will become happy. 'Phrul-gsen gTsug-phud, keep this in mind! This is what he said.

de la yang gsol pa / rgyal bu ston pa gshen rab lags // g.yung drung bon la rgya che grangs mang yang // mdor bsdus theg pa rim dgur gsungs pa yi // theg pa gsum pa 'phrul gshen bon sgo la // spyi yi sde dang sgos kyi bye brag gi // rnam grangs nges par brjod du mchis lags sam // spyod dang 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ci ltar lags // tha ma don dang yon tan ci ltar thob // bdag la nges pa'i bka' gnang mdzad du gsol // ces gsol to /

Then they asked him again: Princely Teacher, Best of Shen, Although the ways of Swastika Bon are vast and numberless, you have said that they are compressed into a set of Nine Vehicles. Now as for the third vehicle, the Bon Way of the Shen of Illusion, will you explain to us clearly the contents of the general divisions and special sections. What are the characteristics of the practice and of starting the practice, and finally what result and what special qualities are gained? We beg you to tell us clearly.
de la yang ston pas bka' stsal pa / nyon cig 'phrul gshen gtsug phud nyon //
Then the Teacher said: Listen 'Phrul-gshen gTsug-phud, listen.
'phrul gshen theg pa'i bon sgo la // spyi ru rnam pa gsum yin te // bsnyen dang bsgrub dang las sbyor ro //
In the Bon Way of the Vehicle of the Shen of Illusion there are three general sections, veneration, conjuration and application.

bsnyen ni dpon gsas lha la bsnyen // mtshan nyid ldan pa'i bla ma ni // gshen rnams kun gyi rab tu ste // ri bo'i sku dang rgya mtsho'i gsung // nam mkha'i thugs can mkhyen dang brtse // mthu dbang byin rlabs phun sum tshogs // mos 'dun gsum gyi sgo nas btsal // skad cig 'bral mi phod pa yis // ma phyir bu 'breng lta bur btsal // 'jigs pa'i tshogs la g.yang za'i phyir // lam 'jigs skyel ma lta bur btsal // rang mos gzhan la dran med pa'i // mdza' mthun snyog pa lta bur btsal // btsal nas rnyed pa'i bsten tshul ni // lus ngag yid dang gsum du'o //

For veneration, one venerates the divine Master-Sages as teachers possessing the right characteristics and as the Best of all Shen. (We liken) their body to a fair mountain, their voice to the ocean, their mind to the sky. In knowledge and love, in strength and grace, they are excellent. One should seek them with three kinds of devotion. One should seek them as a child runs after its mother, not bearing a moment’s separation. One should seek them like an escort on a fearful path, as before an abyss where there is a host of fears. One should seek them as one pursues a loving friend, who is devoted to oneself alone and gives no thought to others. When one has sought out (such a one), the ways of cleaving to the one you have found are threefold (as expressed) by body, speech and mind.

lus kyi phyag dang gus pas bsten // ngag gi bstod tshig gdung bas bsten // yid kyi dad dang 'dun [222b] pas bsten // de yang zhu tshul rnam pa gsum // lus kyi lus srog rgyan la sogs // gang du 'byor lcog gang yod pa // chags med blo yis 'bul la zhu // ngag gi spro dga' dbyangs skyed cing // mchod brjod gdung tshig snyan pas zhu // yid kyi dad dang mos pa dang // dad pa phyir mi ldog pas zhu // de la bsnyen tshul rnam pa gsum // lus bskyed drin can pha ma dang // sems bskyed rdo rje slob dpon dang // mthun pa'i grogs bskyed lha sras lcam // khong pa'i snying dang dpral ba'i mig // lus kyi gtso bo mgo ltar bsnyen // de las 'byung tshul rnam pa gsum // bdag la phan pa'i thugs rje 'byung // gzhan la phan pa'i thabs mchog 'byung // de gnyis zung 'brel mthar phyin 'byung //

With the body you must cleave to him by serving and devotion. With speech you must cleave to him with longing (as expressed) in words of praise. With the mind you must cleave to him with faith and desire. Then there are three ways of asking him (for guidance). Ask him by offering him your body and life, your jewelry and so on, whatever you are able to obtain, whatever there is. Offer it with a mind free from attachment to these things. Ask him with sweet-sounding words of longing and formulas of worship, which arouse melodies of joy. Ask him with irreversible faith, with the faith and devotion of mind. The way of veneration is of three kinds: your kind parents who gave you your body, your Powerbolt-Teacher who produced in you the Thought of Enlightenment, the sacred companion, male or female, who gave rise to loving friendship, all these should be venerated like the heart in your body, the eyes below your forehead, and your head which is the chief part of the body. From this (veneration) there are three kinds of arising: the arising of compassion which benefits oneself, the arising of excellent methods which benefit others, the arising of perfection which is a combination of both.

de'i phyir dpon gsas lha la bsnyen // lus ngag gus pas zhu ba dbul // skad cig 'bral med spyi bor bsgom // mos gus gdung ba gsol ba 'debs // sems bskyed dag pas gzhan phan bsam // rgyud dang lung la gzhig 'grel gtong // man ngag goms 'dris ga dar bslab // 'bral med lhan cig 'grog par bya // dbang gzhi don dang ldan par bya // yid dam lha yi rdzong la zhen // snying po sngags kyis brlab par bya // ting nge 'dzin gyi go cha bgo // thog mar bsnyen pa'i rim pa'o //

So one must venerate the divine Master-Sages. You must make your requests with devotion of body and speech. You must meditate upon them as though they were enthroned above you and so as not to be separated from them for one moment. You must make your supplications with devotion and longing. Concentrate on benefiting others by raising pure Thought towards Enlightenment. Give careful study to the traditions and inspired texts. Learn thoroughly so as to perfect yourself in the teachings. Keep the company (of your lama) without separating from him for a moment. Be possessed of the effects of the four consecrations. Long for the citadels of the tutelary divinities. Learn through spells their very essence. Wear the armour of profound meditation. Firstly then this is the order of veneration.
gnyis pa bsgrub pa'i rim pa la // gnas dang rdzas dang bca' gzhi gsum // ting 'dzin snying po phyag rgya gsum // tshig bshad 'phrin las rjes bya'o //
Secondly as for the ordering of the conjuration, (we distinguish) the place, the items and the preparation, then meditation, essence and gesture, the phases of the liturgy and the afterpart.

gnas ni ri brag 'jigs su rung // yang na dur khrod 'jigs pa ste // rigs kyi srung dang rtags kyis brgyan // rdzas ni gang la gang dgos kyi // [223a] dkyil 'khor lha rdzas mchod pa dang // brten pa'i dam rdzas bsgrub rdzas dang // mkho ba'i phyag cha mthun rdzas dang // gang lcog bsgrub la brtson 'grus bya //

The place should be in fearful mountains or in a fearful cemetery, and it should be adorned with the ‘Family Defenders’ and ‘Family Signs’. The items are whatever may be required in whatever case, the mystic circle, the sacred items of worship, the symbolic articles, the articles for coercing (the divinity), the necessary instruments and suitable articles. You must strive to effect whatever you can.

bca' gzhi dkyil 'khor lha stegs dang // bum pa gtor ma la sogs te // bla gur bla ri yol ba dang // gdugs dang rgyal mtshan la sogs dbub // phun sum tshogs pa'i yo byad bsham // gtsang ma phud kyis phyi g.yen bskang // shel dkar 'od dang nam mkha'i snang // 'od dkar 'dzin dang bon bdag la // srung ba mtshams kyi 'phrin las bcol // sgrub rten lha rdzas yid 'ong dgram // ting 'dzin rnam gsum rim par bsgom // de bzhin nyid snang rgyu yis bskyed // snying po rnam gsum yi ge 'bru // lha sku thig le bzhu 'du bya // bca' sgyur phyag rgya mkha' la dgrol //

For preparations you must set up the table for the mystic circle, the vase, the sacrificial cakes and so on, the canopy and the curtains, umbrellas, banners of victory and so on. You must prepare the very best of things. With pure offerings make atonement to the outer regions of the nongods, and set the guardian divinities to their work in the (four) quarters, Shel-dkar-hod (in the east), Nam-mkha'i-snang (in the north), 'o-dkar-'dzin (in the west) and Bon-bdag (in the south). One must arrange in a pleasing way the ritual articles and sacred items. One must concentrate on meditation in three stages: the very truth itself (de-bzhin-nyid) its universal manifestation (kun-tu snang-ba) its substantial manifestation (rgyu). The essence is of three parts, the seed-syllables, the divine form and the dissolution into the central dot. (The gesture consists of) the hands at rest, the turning of the hands, the forming of the gesture, the release of the gesture in space.

mkha' la gsas dbab klong du bstim // gnyis su med par dam tshig bsre // mchod pa'i yo byad 'dod yon rdzas // mngon sprul nam mkha'i mtha' mnyam dbul // dgyes skong thugs dam rgyud nas bskul // tshig bshad gyer dang bskul ba'i brda // rnga gshang rol mos snyan gsan dbab // dbyings nas ye shes mngon spyan drang // dug lnga rang grol khri gdan dbul // sgo gsum phyag 'tshal sdig pa bshag // mkha' gsal ye shes mchod pas bskang // bdud rtsi sman gyi rgyud la brten // thugs dam bdag dang bar mtshams sbrel // phyag rgya gar gyis snod bcud rol // sku bstod 'phrin las dbyings su bcol // bla med grub pa'i rtags su gsal // dkyil 'khor sgo dbye bdag zhal blta // gnyis su med par gtan dam bca' // mchog dang thun mong dngos grub gsol // dbang bzhi yongs rdzogs byin rlabs [223b] blang // bcol pa'i 'phrin las dbyings su bsgrub // dbal mo'i za lam dgra la bstan // las kyi 'phrin las dbyings su bsdu // bdag med rang bzhin mkha' la bstim // bdag gzhan don grub klong du mnyam // de rnams sgrub pa'i rim pa'o //

(There are gestures for) inviting the gSas from the skies, for their absorption into space, for uniting as one in the sacrament, for indicating items of worship and desirable things, which one offers in illusory form equalling in extent the limits of the sky, thus pleasing and satisfying them, and urging them in accordance with their thoughtful purposes. The liturgy consists of the incantations and the sounds for urging on (the gods), drums, flat bells, with these sounds one calls them, inviting the gods of knowledge down from the celestial spheres. One must offer them the thrones of the ‘Five Evils Self-Released’, salute them with body, speech and mind, and confess ones faults. One must make atonement to them with the worship known as ‘Knowledge of the Clear Sky’, and make use of the traditional means of elixir and medicaments. The tutelary divinity and oneself are brought together in the intervening space (which once separated them). The world and its creatures sport in a gesturing dance. One praises the forms (of the gods) and urges them to their tasks in the celestial spheres. There is clarity in the (divine) signs so excellently effected. (As for the afterpart) one opens the mystic circle and sees the face of the chief divinity, and one makes the firm vow of never being two, and begs for the special powers of both the extraordinary and the ordinary kind. One receives the perfect grace (flowing from) the four ritual acts, and one effects in the celestial spheres the tasks to which (the divinities) are committed. The consuming way of the dBal-mo is turned upon one’s enemies. The phases of the rite are concentrated in the celestial spheres. Selfless self-nature is absorbed into the heavens. That which is effected for self and for others is resolved into the sameness of space. Such is the order of the conjuration.

gsum la las la sbyor ba la // brnag pa rgyu 'phrul dra ba la // 'gal dang 'brel ba zung du 'jug // 'phrul gshen theg pa'i bon sgo la // spyod lam 'gal zhing don la 'brel // drag po'i sa gnas spyod la 'gal // thams cad dbang bsdus don la 'brel // brnag pa'i las ka spyod la 'gal // bstan pa'i so 'dzug don la 'brel //

Thirdly as for the application, in this magic net of ferocity contradiction and coherence join in pairs. In this bon way of the Vehicle of the Shen of Illusion there is contradiction in the practice and coherence in the result. Staying in a wild place contradicts normal practice, but subduing all to one’s power is coherent in result. Ferocious actions contradict normal practice, but to establish the doctrine is coherent in result.

sha khrag dmar mchod spyod la 'gal // sbyor sgrol rol pa don la 'brel // dam rdzas lnga po spyod la 'gal // dug lnga gnas dag don la 'brel // mtshan ldan gzungs ma spyod la 'gal // thabs shes dbyer med don la 'brel // rtogs pa'i rgyang mtshams spyod la 'gal // dben pa'i gnas brten don la 'brel // brnag pa'i zhe sdang spyod la 'gal // rang bzhin byams pa don la 'brel // dregs pa'i nga rgyal spyod la 'gal // zhing khams zhi bde'i don la 'brel // thabs kyi rdzu 'phrul spyod la 'gal // log rtog 'dul ba don la 'brel // dgra la brnag pa spyod la 'gal // bar chod dben pa don la 'brel // phan gnod 'dzin pa spyod la 'gal // 'gro la phan bde don la 'brel // bzang ngan nye ring spyod la 'gal // bzang po spyod pa don la 'brel // legs nyes 'dzin pa spyod la 'gal // legs pa'i bya ba don la 'brel // srog gi 'khor lo spyod la 'gal // ma rig gnas spar don la [224a] 'brel // mang sa'i gtor ma spyod la 'gal // gti mug rang grol don la 'brel // rak ta'i mchod pa spyod la 'gal // 'dod chags rtsad gcad don la 'brel // rus pa'i gram khrod spyod la 'gal // zhe sdang dbyings sgrol don la 'brel // zhing chen g.yang gzhi spyod la 'gal // 'phrag dog rang grol don la 'brel // srog dbugs mchod pa spyod la 'gal // nga rgyal rtsad gcad don la 'brel // yu ti'i mchod pa spyod la 'gal // g.yu 'brang bdud rtsi don la 'brel // bhAN Da lcang lo spyod la 'gal // mtshan ldan yol chen don la 'brel // drag po'i phur pa spyod la 'gal // 'khor ba gting non don la 'brel //

Red offerings of flesh and blood contradict normal practice, but the three practices of ritual union, ritual slaughter and magical manifestation are coherent in result. The five sacred items contradict normal practice, but to purify the Five Evils is coherent in result. The special female partner contradicts normal practice, but when Method and Wisdom are mutually indistinguishable this is coherent in result. To cut oneself off far from learning contradicts normal practice, but to keep to a desolate place is coherent in result. Ferocious anger contradicts normal practice, but a loving nature is coherent in result. Arrogant pride contradicts normal practice, but to reduce the world to peace and happiness is coherent in result. Methodical magic contradicts normal practice, but to suppress false considerations is coherent in result. Ferocity with regard to enemies contradicts normal practice, but to remove obstructions is coherent in result. To cause benefits by causing harm contradicts normal practice, but to bring (overall) benefits to living beings is coherent in result. To practise good and evil near and far contradicts normal practice, but the (overall) practice of good is coherent in result. To cause both good and harm contradicts normal practice, but when done for good it is coherent in result. The Circle-of-Life Practice contradicts normal practice, but to raise the position of the ignorant is coherent in result. The sacrificial offering of meat contradicts normal practice, but to rescue the stupid is coherent in result. The offering of blood contradicts normal practice, but to root out desire is coherent in result. The heap of bones contradicts normal practice, but to dispose of wrath is coherent in result. The use of human skins contradicts normal practice, but to dispose of envy is coherent in result. To sacrifice the life (of creatures) contradicts normal practice, but to root out pride is coherent in result. To use chang for worship contradicts normal practice, but the consecrated chang is coherent in result. The use of hairy skulls contradicts normal practice, but the special skull-shaped vessel is coherent in result. The ferocious ritual dagger contradicts normal practice, but to suppress the cycle of existence is coherent in result.

e klong 'brub khung spyod la 'gal // bon nyid klong yangs don la 'brel // rtsang dmar mtshon cha spyod la 'gal // srid pa'i dra ba don la 'brel // dmigs pa'i ling ga spyod la 'gal // ma rtogs 'dul ba don la 'brel // sreg 'phang mnan gsum spyod la 'gal // bon nyid gnas spar don la 'brel // de ltar 'gal 'brel cha mthun pa'i // brnag pa rgyu 'phrul dra ba la // phyi rgyud nang rgyud gsang rgyud gsum // phyi rgyud mkha' 'gying dbal gyi rgyud // nang rgyud dbal gsas drag po'i rgyud // gsang rgyud las kyi thig le'i rgyud // phyi rgyud mkha' 'gying dbal tshogs la // dzo dbal thigs kyi sngags byad dang // lha rgod nyi khri'i dmod byad dang // ma mo thun gyi zor byad dang // nag po bdud kyi lda byad bzhi // 'phrin las bzhi yi gzhung la 'brel // dbal gsas drag po'i brnag pa la // dbang sdud las kyi brnag pa dang // drag po bzlog pa'i 'khor lo dang // drag po [224b] rdzu 'phrul rgyud chen dang // zil gnon khyung nag ral chen bzhi // las bzhi brnag pa'i rgyud bzhi byung //

The triangular smiting cavity contradicts normal practice, but if bon itself extends through space, this is coherent in result. Red stakes and weapons contradict normal practice, but the net of existence is coherent in result. The Lingga Practice with (foes) envisaged contradicts normal practice, but the subduing of ignorance is coherent in result. To burn, to send flying, to hold down, these three acts contradict normal practice, but to elevate bon is coherent in result. In this magic net of ferocity where contradiction and coherence are related in pairs, there are three tantric series, the outer, the inner and the secret. The outer series is the tantra of mKha'-'gying-dbal. The inner series is the tantra of Fierce dBal-gsas. The secret series is the tantra of the Essences of Acts (of the dBal-mo). In the outer series, the group of mKha'-'gying-dbal there is the malevolence of spells of Dzo-dbal-thigs, the malevolence of imprecations of the 20,000 wild gods, the malevolence of the hurled offerings of the mother-goddesses, the special malevolence of the black demons, making four in all. They are connected with the basic tradition of the four ritual acts. In the ferocious practice of Fierce dBal-gsas, there is the ferocity of the subduing act, the fierce circle of expulsion, the great tantra of magic, the fierce one, the subduer Khyung-nag ral-chen, making four in all. These four acts occur as the four ferocious tantras.
gsang rgyud las kyi thig le la // dbal mo las kyi thig le dang // dbal mo srog gi thig le dang // dbal mo srog gi spu gri dang // dbal mo las kyi byang bu bzhi // sum cu rtsa gsum 'brel nas byung //

In the secret series, the Essences of Acts, there are the essences of acts of the dBal-mo, the essences of the life-force of the dBal-mo, the razor of life-force of the dBal-mo, the indications of actions of the dBal-mo. They occur in connexion with the thirty-three.
de ltar rgyud chen bcu gnyis la // las mkhan 'jig rten dmod byad bcas // sngags 'grel brgya dang rtsa brgyad byung // de la yang 'grel stong rtsa gnyis // bcas dang lag len ldan par bya //

Thus with these twelve tantras which include as expedients the malevolence of imprecations of the gods of the world, there are 108 tantric commentaries, and furthermore 1,002 subsidiary commentaries. Subsidiary technical matters are also to be included.

de ltar sgrub bsnyen mthar bskyal nas // drag po'i las la sbyor ba na // drag po 'jigs pa'i gnas dag tu // e klong drag po'i thun khang bca' // gza' skar pra ltas shis la 'jug // lha ni dbal gsas rngam pa bsgom // bdud ni mi mthun log lta 'dul // srog gi 'khor lo gnad la bsnun // mi ldog srog yig them la blang // gnad la bskor la gcun la 'bor // brten pa'i gta' gzugs srog mkhar gzugs // sha khrag dmar la dbal mo dbab // 'jig rten lha rgod phud kyis mchod // mchod dang brten pa'i las la brtson // dgra dang bgegs kyi ming byang 'bri // dmigs pa'i 'ben la gsal bar bskyed // thun dang sna tshogs mtshon chas bsnun // dgug dang bstim dang gsad dang bsgral // bstab dang rol dang thugs dam bskang // brnag pa'i las la snying rje med // las sbyor mtha' [225a] ru phyin par bya // sreg 'phang mnan gsum skabs dang sbyar // rjes shul bon nyid rgya yis gdab // 'phrul gshen gtsug phud dbal gyi gshen // brnag pa'i las sbyor thugs la zhog // sems can 'gro la sman par mdzod //

Having thus completed this account of conjuration and veneration, (we come to) the practical application of ferocity. In a wild and fearsome place prepare the magic receptacle of the ferocious triangle, and set to work when the stars and other prognostics are auspicious. Meditate upon dBal-gsas the Fierce One as presiding divinity, and suppress as demons antagonistic false views. Pierce the Circle-of-Life to the heart. Take the infallible Life-Letter as the symbol. Encircle the heart and reduce it to subjection. Set up the pledge-symbols of the attendant (divinities) and set up the ‘life-force citadel’. Call down the dBol-mo for the offerings of flesh and blood. Worship with offerings the wild gods of this world. Make effort in the worship and the actions of service. Write the name-cards of foes and obstructors. Produce a clear idea of the envisaged target. Sting with the deterrents and various weapons. (The whole process consists of) coercing (the enemy), dissolving (him into the lihga), slaying (him) and disposing of him, then offering, rejoicing and atonement. In these ferocious acts there is no compassion. This practical application must be performed in its entirety. To burn, to send flying, to hold down, these three acts must suit the occasion. After all is over, set upon it the seal of bon. hPhrulrgien gTsug-phud, Shen of dBal. Keep in mind this ferocious application, and do good to living beings.

yang rgyal bus bka' stsal pa / nyon cig 'phrul gshen gtsug phud la sogs // 'dus pa'i 'khor rnams thams cad kun // theg pa gsum pa 'phrul gshen la // 'jug cing spyod pa'i gang zag rnams // spyir yang bon rnams thams cad la // sems bskyed gzhi ma mi ldan na // zhing sa ngan pa'i sa bon 'dra // skam la bab na 'bras bu 'tshig // myu gu 'khrung bar ga la 'gyur //

Again the Prince spoke: Listen hPhrul-gsen gTsug-phud and all your entourage assembled here. People who enter and practise this third vehicle of the Shen of Illusion, if in regard to all bon in general they do not have as the basis (of their practice) the raising of their Thought to Enlightenment, they are like seed which is thrown on bad ground. For if it is thrown in a dry place, it shrivels up, so how can the shoot come to birth?

de'i phyir bon la spyod pa la // rang la phan pa'i dad pa dgos // gzhan la phan pa'i sems bskyed dgos // sems bskyed rtsa ba snying rje yin // dad pa'i rtsa ba mi rtag yin // mi rtag rtsa ba stong pa nyid // stong pa snying rje zung 'brel yin // 'gro ba thar pa de yis 'drong // de'i phyir snying rje bskyed par bya // snying rje bdag phyogs med par bskyed // bdag phyogs byung na snying rje gol // khra spyang snying rje bdag phyogs can // 'gro la mi phan rang mthun gso // de la 'bras bu chung bar byed // 'gro la ma ltar byams pa dang // kun la nyi ltar bsnyam pa dang // sems bskyed gzhi ma ldan par bya // bag yod bzhin du spyad par bya // 'gro ba gang la gang phan bya // sems bskyed ma gol gzhan phan bya // 'phrul gshen theg pa rgyu yi bon // lung dang tshul bzhin spyad pa na // don la mi gol 'jug sgo'i lam // yan lag thabs kyi bon yin te // 'bras bu'i theg [225b] pa a dkar bsnyag // don du a dkar sa la nges // thabs shes dbyer med 'bras bu thob // de'i phyir de'i don la slobs // 'di yi don la 'jug par gyis // 'di yi don la brtag par bya // 'di yi don la spyod par gyis // 'di yi don la bsgom par gyis // 'di yi don la bsgrub par gyis // 'di yi don la gnas par gyis // des na don dang yon tan ni // 'di la 'jug dang rtogs pa yis // khams gsum 'khor ba'i sa bsgral nas // mos par spyod pa'i sa la gnas // mos spyod sa bzhi yar brgal nas // g.yung drung sa bcu rim par bgrod //

Thus in the practice of bon one must have the faith that will benefit oneself, and one must raise one’s Thought to Enlightenment as benefiting others. The basis for thus raising Thought is compassion. The basis of faith is impermanence. The basis of impermanence is Voidness. Voidness and Compassion go together as a pair. By their means beings are led to salvation, so one must exercise compassion. But one must exercise compassion free of self-interest. If self-interest arises, this contradicts compassion. The hawk and the wolf have compassion of a self-interested kind. It does not benefit others. It preserves one’s own kind. The fruits of this are very small. Loving living beings like a mother, practising the same towards everyone, as does the sun, you must have as the basis (of your action) this raising of the Thought (towards Enlightenment). You must act carefully. You must do whatever benefits living beings in whatever case. Do nothing to contradict this raising of one’s Thought and act for others’ benefit. The Way of the Shen of Illusion is Bon of Cause. But if it is practised according to the inspired teachings, and according to custom, it will not be contradictory in effect. Rather it will be an entrance-way. It is bon of a methodical kind, and it reaches out towards the Way of Effect of ‘Pure Sound’. In result it is sure (to reach) the stage of ‘Pure Sound’. It achieves the effect where Method and Wisdom are indistinguishable. Therefore do your learning with this as the intended result. Investigate towards this result. Practise towards this result. Meditate towards this result. Perform conjurations towards this result. Be resolute towards this result. So as for the result and the accomplishments, by starting on this Way and comprehending it, one traverses the stages of this threefold world, and abides in the stage of ‘Devotional Practice’. Having traversed the four stages of ‘Devotional Practice’, one traverses in order the ten Swastika stages.

g.yung drung sa bcu rim bgrod nas // kun snang gling du mngon 'tshang rgya // kun snang gling du sangs rgyas nas // 'gro ba sems can dpal du 'gyur // mthar thug yon tan de ltar thob // gnas skabs yon tan bsam las 'das // 'jig rten zhing 'dir bde legs dang // sangs rgyas bstan pa dar ba dang // g.yung drung dbu 'phang mtho ba dang // zhing khams bde la dgod pa yi // cha gcig 'phrul gshen thabs la thug // stag lha me 'bar sprul pa'i gshen // 'phrul gshen gtsug phud ngo mtshar can // 'phrul gshen gtsug phud la gnyer gtad // kho ma ne chung bdag tu bsko // grong khyer sgyu 'phrul dga' ba la // bon gyi 'khor lo bskor bar mdzod // ces bka' stsal to /

Having traversed the ten swastika stages, one gains buddhahood at the stage of Universal Shining Light. Having gained buddhahood at this stage, one becomes the glory of living beings. One gains perfect accomplishments like these, and one’s accidental accomplishments surpass all thought. For one thing the Way of the Shen of Illusion is concerned with a method for happiness in this world, for spreading the Buddhist doctrine, for raising the Swastika dignity, and for establishing the spheres of existence in bliss. Of Shen of Illusion, sTag-lha me-'bar, 'Phrul-gshen gTsug-phud, most wonderful. I give the responsibility to you 'Phrul-gshen gTsug-phud. You must take charge of the Palace Kho-ma-ne-chuhg, and turn the wheel of bon in the city of sGyu-'phrul-dga'-ba. This is what he said.
IV. SRID GSHEN THEG PA
IV. THE WAY OF THE SHEN OF EXISTENCE

theg pa bzhi pa srid gshen 'chad par byed // 'khor ba'i sems can ma rig nyon mongs [ga 27b] rnams // rang rig ma rtogs ma rig 'khrul 'khor 'khyam // skye shi kha brgyud sha yi gdos pa can // ma rig pa la nyon mongs nad du ldang // bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi nad kyi sdug bsngal gdung // ma rtogs pa la don gyi khu 'phrig ldang // stong phrag drug cu gdon gyi lan chags bsnyag // 'chi sa ma nges 'chi ba'i gnas ma nges // 'chi rkyen ma nges 'chi ba'i dus ma nges // rgas dang gzhon dang byis pa skyes ma thag // gri dang 'khrugs pa nad dang yams la sogs // glo bur ye 'brog sdug bsngal sbyang dang 'chi // ma rig ma rtogs 'khrul pa'i las dbang gis // bla yid sems gsum dum bu gsum du mthong // bdag med stong pa'i ngo bo ma rtogs pas // rig pa bdag med bdag po gnyis su 'dzin // gcig ni lhan cig skyes pa'i lha ru 'dod // gcig ni lhan cig skyes pa'i 'dre ru 'dod //

I shall explain the fourth vehicle, the Shen of Existence. The living beings of samsāra, ignorant and afflicted, not understanding self-knowledge, ignorantly wander in a circle of illusion. Things of flesh, linked in a series of birth and death, in their ignorance their afflictions take the form of disease. They are distressed with the sufferings of the 404 types of disease. Erroneous views of things are aroused in the case of the ignorant, and they are pursued by the 60,000 demonish retributions. The place of death is uncertain and the condition of death is uncertain. The circumstances of death and the time of death are uncertain. The old, the young, the children and those just born, by murder, riot, sickness, plague and the rest, experiencing sudden injuries and miseries, they die. By force of deluded karmic effects, with no knowledge and no understanding, they regard spirit, thought and mind as three separate parts. Not understanding the void nature of the non-self, the knowledge, which is non-self, they conceive as two selves. One they assert to be the innate divinity. One they assert to be the innate demon.

lha yis phan cing 'dre yis gnod pa dang // dbugs len srog gcod bdud phyir 'breng ba dang // gnas dang yul dang 'dug sa 'tshol ba dang // dge sdig rgyu 'bras dkar nag mthong ba dang // 'chi bdag gshin rje'i sdug bsngal sbyang ba dang // de ltar gcig la du mar 'dzin pa yis // bde ba'i skabs med 'chi kha'i nad pa 'dra // dbang po kun tshang tshu rol gnas dang 'dra // thogs pa med pa bar snang rlung dang 'dra // 'jigs skrag bred pa ri dwags rgyar chud 'dra // yid kha rmong ba sa mtha'i ku hrang 'dra // thar du mi re mun khang btson dong 'dra // 'dug sa 'tshol ba bye'u phrug [28a] tshang yar 'dra // skyabs gnas med pa dwa phrug mas bor 'dra // bkres shing skom pa yi dwags dbul 'phongs 'dra // yid la mi bde zil bsgyur 'dres bded 'dra // rang dbang med pa la kha'i bya sgro 'dra // gzhan dbang bsgyur ba khrims kyi mnga' 'og 'dra //

Gods are of help to them and demons do harm. Their breath is withdrawn, they are killed and they run after devils, seeking a place and a country and somewhere to stay. Good and evil, cause and effect, white and black are seen, and they experience the sufferings of the master of death, the Lord of the Dead. Thus they conceive of one as many. There is no occasion of happiness. It resembles the sickness of the time of one’s death. Their sense powers (after death) are complete like those that remain on this side, but unobstructed they pass through space like the wind. They are frightened and fearful like a deer which has entered a trap. Their thoughts are confused like the wild ass of the frontier regions. They have no hope of release, as though emprisoned in a dungeon. They search for their resting place, like a young bird for its nest. They have no place of refuge, like an orphan child, or one abandoned by its mother. They are hungry and thirsty like poor tormented spirits. Their thoughts are unhappy and frenzied, as though pursued by demons. They have no power of their own, like a feather on the top of a pass. They are like those who have fallen into another’s power and remain under punishment.

sdug bsngal nyon mongs de yi gdung ba la // rgyal ba'i thabs dang thugs rjes ma 'gag phyir // srid gshen bon gyi thabs dang brda sbyor la // shi thabs rgan gzhon dar rgyas byis pa'i tshogs // shi rkyen nad dang dug mtshon gdon la sogs // gang du ma nges rkyen gyis shi ba la // 'dur thabs de dang mthun par gang 'dul gyis // gson gshin brda sprod sdug bsngal thang la dbyung // bla yid sems gsum lus sems gcig tu sdus // bar sa de la gnas pa'i gnas su zhog // sngon gyi bag chags rjes dran bon sgo ston // bde ba'i gnas snyog bon nyid sa la khod // srid gshen gtsug phud thugs kyi dkyil du zhog //

In order not to check the Conqueror’s Method and Compassion in the case of those tormented with such sufferings and afflictions, there is this method and instruction of the bon of the Shen of Existence. The many ways of death (affecting) old and young, the mature and the children, the circumstances of death, sickness, poison, weapons, demons and so on, in the case of such uncertainties of place and circumstance, do whatever in the way of death rites accords with the way of death. The living must explain to the deceased and get rid of his suffering. Spirit, thought and mind must be united as a single unity of body and mind. Take stock of the place where he is in the Intermediate State. Remind him of adverse influences from former births, and show him the door of bon. Lead him on to a place of happiness and place him in the realm of true bon. Srid-gsen gTsug-phud, keep this in mind..
[vol. ga, f. 29a2]

de ltar kun rdzob mtshan ma la // mtshan ma dngos po bden dgos pas // srid pa rgyud kyi bon po yis // thog mar rtsis kyis gtan la dbab // rtsis kyis gtan la ma phab na // gang la gang dgos shan mi phyed // de'i phyir skye ba snga phyi dang // da lta'i tshe tshad ring thung dang // rgyu rkyen shi rabs yin tshul dang // rjes shul bkrag dang mi bkrag dang // de la phan dang mi phan dang // don rtags gtan la dbab par bya //

Thus the characteristics of relative truth (viz. the phenomenal world), are acceptable as true with regard to the things themselves. So the bonpo of the original tradition must first get matters in order by means of calculation. If he does not order things by means of calculation, he cannot decide what is required in each case. So he must get into order all the indications of the affair: former and future births, the measure and length of the present life, the cause, circumstances and manner of death, the prosperity or absence of prosperity of those left behind, and what will be of benefit and not of benefit in the case.

gnyis pa gto gnyan gtad bcol la // rin chen gser gyi sa gzhi la // dbang chen bdag po mnga' dbang che // de las gzhi bslang 'dur dgos pas // rgyal po'i sa dang blon pa'i sa // btsun mo ded dpon bran khol dang // gong na gnyan pa la sogs pa // gang du shi ba brtag par bya //

Secondly he must perform the rite for coercing the furies (viz. the Lords of the Soil). In this earthly domain with its gems and gold the powerful Lords (of the Soil) are strong in their power. So you must ask a site from them and consecrate it. A site for a king, or a site for a minister, for a queen, for a military commander, for a servant, those who are important by rank and so on, you must examine where the dead man (should rest).
de la gzhi bslang cho gas bcos // srid pa shi rabs lo rgyus las // sngon gyi srid pa chags pa nas // srid pa dpe blang da lta'i bar // srid pa'i lugs su bon smrang gyer //

Then ask for the site and prepare it ceremonially. From the stories about the original ordering of death, how it originally arose in the first place, taking the original archetype up to the present time, chant the bon exposition in its original form.

gdos pa thag chod chags pa bsal // 'khor ba'i gag sel zhen pa skyur // [29b] dpe don shi rabs lo rgyus bshad // bla yid sems gsum 'thor ba sdud // legs kyang g.yeng khams bying ba gsing // thar pa bde ba'i lam la bkod // kun rdzob mtshan mar dngos po bden // mthar ni don dam klong du sdud // srid ni thams cad srid pas srid // gshen ni de dag 'dul ba'i gshen // lta ba bla yid sems dang gsum // sdud cing thar pa 'dren par lta // sgom pa bdag gzhan gnyis med do // btang snyoms chen po'i ting 'dzin bsgom // spyod pa 'gro ba thams cad la // byams dang brtse ba'i tshul du bya // 'bras bu ye gshen theg pa bsnyag // lha ni 'dur gsas rma bo bsgom // srid gshen gtsug phud thugs la zhog // kun rdzob mtshan ma'i 'dur bon no // don dam bden pa'i 'dur ba ni // gshen rab lta dgongs rtsal ldan gyis // 'gro ba nyams thag sems can la // snying rje dpa' med bskyed nas su // tshad med bzhi dang ldan pa yis // rang bas gzhan don gtsor byed cing // mtshan ma'i rdzas la lus sems gzung // dung shog dkar la g.yu ris bri // dri ma skye mched tshang bar bya // ngan song gnas sbyang sa bon dgod // bar chod bgegs bskrad gshed dang phral // bla yid sems gsum gcig tu sprad // bde bar gshegs pa mchod pa 'bul // ris drug bgegs la sbyin pa gtang //

Fix the material elements. Clarify their arising. Remove the impediment of the phenomenal circle, and get rid of consuming desire. Thus tell the story of the ordering of death (according to) the meaning of the archetype. Bring together those three, spirit, thought and mind, which are scattered. Although happy, he is inattentive. Disperse the indolence of his disposition. Establish him in the way of salvation and bliss. Take these things as true in terms of the characteristics of phenomenal truth.
